 13624                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13625                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13626                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13627                                  ;
 13628                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13629                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13630                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13631                                  ;	    drive)
 13632                                  ;
 13633                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13634                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13635                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13636                                  ;
 13637                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13638                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13639                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13640                                  ;
 13641                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13642                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13643                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13644                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13645                                  ;
 13646                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13647                                  ;
 13648                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13649                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13650                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13651                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13652                                  ; 
 13653                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13654                                  
 13655                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13656                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13657 000012D4 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13658 000012D8 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13659                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13660                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13661 000012DB 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13662 000012DD 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13663                                  		;
 13664 000012DF 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13665                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13666                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13667                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13668 000012E3 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13669                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13670 000012E5 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13671 000012E7 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13672 000012E9 FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13673                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13674 000012EB FEC8                    		dec	al
 13675 000012ED 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13676 000012EF 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13677 000012F1 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13678 000012F3 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13679 000012F5 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13680 000012F7 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13681 000012F9 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13682                                  GotMediaType:				
 13683 000012FB 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13684                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13685                                  		; cf = 0
 13686                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13687 000012FE C3                      		retn
 13688                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13689                                  
 13690                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13691 000012FF 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13692 00001302 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13693 00001304 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13694 00001306 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13695 00001309 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13696                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13697 0000130B B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13698                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13699 0000130D B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13700 0000130F F9                      		stc
 13701 00001310 C3                      		retn
 13702                                  
 13703                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13704                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13705                                  		;db    0
 13706                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13707                                  
 13708                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13709                                  
 13710                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13711                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13712                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13713                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13714                                  
 13715                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13716                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13717                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13718                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13719                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13720                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13721                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13722                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13723                                  ;
 13724                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13725                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13726                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13727                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13728                                  ;
 13729                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13730                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13731                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13732                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13733                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13734                                  ;
 13735                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13736                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13737                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13738                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13739                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13740                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13741                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13742                                  
 13743                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13744                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13745                                  
 13746                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13747                                  
 13748                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13749 00001311 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13750 00001314 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13751 00001316 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13752 00001319 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13753                                  
 13754                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13755                                  
 13756 0000131B 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13757 0000131E 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13758 00001320 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13759 00001323 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13760 00001325 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13761                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13762                                  
 13763                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13764 00001328 CF                      		iret
 13765                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13766                                  
 13767                                  int2f_replace_int13:
 13768 00001329 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13769 0000132A 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13770                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13771                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13772                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13773 0000132C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13774                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13775                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13776                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13777                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13778                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13779                                  		
 13780                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13781                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13782 00001331 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13783                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13784 00001335 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13785                                  
 13786                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13787                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13788                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13789                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13790                                  		
 13791                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13792                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13793 00001339 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13794 0000133D A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13795                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13796                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13797 00001340 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13798 00001344 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13799                                  
 13800 00001348 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13801                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13802                                  		;pop	bx
 13803 00001349 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13804                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13805 0000134A 58                      		pop	ax
 13806                                  i2f_iret:
 13807 0000134B CF                      		iret
 13808                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13809                                  
 13810                                  mine:
 13811 0000134C 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions

 14007                                  
 14008                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14009                                  
 14010                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14011                                  ;
 14012                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 14013                                  ;
 14014                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 14015                                  ;							seg ffff )
 14016                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 14017                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 14018                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 14019                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 14020                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 14021                                  ;
 14022                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 14023                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 14024                                  ;
 14025                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14026                                  
 14027                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14028                                  HMAPtr:
 14029 0000140C 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14030                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 14031 00001411 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14032                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14033 00001415 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14034 00001418 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14035 0000141A 803E[9208]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 14036                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 14037 0000141F 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 14038 00001421 FF1E[8E08]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14039                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 14040 00001425 8B3E[8C08]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 14041                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 14042                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 14043 00001429 C3                      		retn
 14044                                  
 14045                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14046                                  
 14047                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14048                                  
 14049                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 14050                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 14051                                  
 14052                                  move_sector:
 14053                                  
 14054                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 14055                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 14056                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 14057                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 14058                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 14059                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 14060                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 14061                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 14062                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 14063                                  ;
 14064                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 14065                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 14066                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 14067                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 14068                                  ; back to a byte move.
 14069                                  
 14070 0000142A FC                      		cld
 14071 0000142B 51                      		push	cx
 14072 0000142C B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 14073 0000142F 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 14074 00001433 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14075 00001435 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 14076 00001439 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 14077 0000143B F3A5                    		rep movsw
 14078 0000143D 59                      		pop	cx
 14079 0000143E C3                      		retn
 14080                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14081                                  
 14082                                  movsec_bytes:				
 14083 0000143F D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 14084 00001441 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 14085 00001443 59                      		pop	cx
 14086 00001444 C3                      		retn
 14087                                  
 14088                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14089                                  
 14090                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14091                                  
 14092                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 14093                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 14094                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 14095                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 14096                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 14097                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 14098                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 14099                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 14100                                  ;
 14101                                  ; input conditions:
 14102                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 14103                                  ;
 14104                                  ; output:
 14105                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 14106                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 14107                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 14108                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 14109                                  
 14110                                  check_wrap:	
 14111 00001445 50                      		push	ax
 14112 00001446 53                      		push	bx
 14113 00001447 06                      		push	es
 14114 00001448 57                      		push	di
 14115 00001449 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 14116 0000144C 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 14117                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14118 0000144E 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14119                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14120 00001453 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 14121 00001455 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14122 00001459 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 14123 0000145B 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 14124 0000145E 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 14125 00001460 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 14126 00001462 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 14127                                  
 14128                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 14129                                  ; last sector on that track.
 14130                                  
 14131 00001464 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 14132 00001466 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 14133                                  		; 18/12/2022
 14134 00001468 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 14135 00001469 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 14136                                  					; if on	boundary
 14137                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 14138                                  not_on_bound:
 14139 0000146B 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 14140 0000146E 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 14141 00001470 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 14142 00001472 40                      		inc	ax
 14143 00001473 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 14144 00001475 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 14145                                  		; 02/09/2023
 14146 00001478 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14147 0000147C 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 14148                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14149                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 14150 0000147E 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 14151 00001480 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 14152 00001481 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 14153                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 14154 00001483 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 14155                                  
 14156                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 14157                                  
 14158 00001485 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 14159 00001487 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 14160 00001489 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 14161                                  
 14162                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 14163                                  
 14164 0000148B 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 14165 0000148D 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 14166 0000148F 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 14167                                  no_head_bound:				
 14168 00001490 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 14169 00001492 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 14170 00001493 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 14171 00001495 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 14172 00001497 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 14173 00001499 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 14174 0000149C B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 14175 0000149E 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 14176 000014A0 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 14177 000014A2 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 14178 000014A4 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 14179 000014A6 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 14180 000014A8 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 14181 000014AA 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 14182                                  no_wrap:				
 14183 000014AC F8                      		clc
 14184 000014AD 5F                      		pop	di
 14185 000014AE 07                      		pop	es
 14186 000014AF 5B                      		pop	bx
 14187 000014B0 58                      		pop	ax
 14188 000014B1 C3                      		retn
 14189                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14190                                  
 14191                                  no_wrap_head:				
 14192 000014B2 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 14193 000014B4 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 14194 000014B6 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 14195                                  
 14196                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14197                                  
 14198                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14199                                  
 14200                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 14201                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 14202                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 14203                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 14204                                  ;
 14205                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 14206                                  
 14207                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14208                                  find_bds:	
 14209 000014B8 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 14210                                  fbds_1:					
 14211 000014BC 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14212 000014C0 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 14213 000014C2 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 14214                                  					; go to next bds
 14215 000014C5 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 14216 000014C8 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 14217 000014CA F9                      		stc
 14218                                  fdbs_2:					
 14219 000014CB C3                      		retn
 14220                                  
 14221                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14222                                  
 14223                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14224                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14225                                  doint:
 14226                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14227 000014CC 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14228                                  					; get physical drive number
 14229                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 14230                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 14231                                  		
 14232 000014CF 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14233 000014D1 08C0                    		or	al, al
 14234 000014D3 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 14235                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14236 000014D5 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14237                                  					; get request code
 14238                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 14239 000014D8 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14240                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 14241 000014DB 9D                      		popf
 14242                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 14243                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14244 000014DC 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14245                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 14246                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14247 000014E1 9C                      		pushf
 14248                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14249 000014E2 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 14250                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 14251                                  dointdone:				
 14252 000014E5 C3                      		retn
 14253                                  
 14254                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14255                                  
 14256                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14257                                  
 14258                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 14259                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 14260                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 14261                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 14262                                  ;
 14263                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 14264                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 14265                                  ;
 14266                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 14267                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 14268                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 14269                                  
 14270                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 14271                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 14272                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 14273                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 14274                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 14275                                  ;.olddx: resw
 14276                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 14277                                  ;.olddd: resd
 14278                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 14279                                  ;end struc
 14280                                  
 14281                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14282                                  
 14283                                  ;   entry conditions:
 14284                                  ;	ah = function
 14285                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 14286                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 14287                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 14288                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 14289                                  ;   output conditions:
 14290                                  ;	no dma violation.
 14291                                  
 14292                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 14293                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 14294                                  ;
 14295                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 14296                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 14297                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 14298                                  
 14299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14300                                  
 14301                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14302                                  
 14303 000014E6 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 14304                                  
 14305                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14306                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 14307                                  ; 09/12/2022
 14308                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 14309                                  
 14310                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14311                                  
 14312                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 14313                                  
 14314                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 14315                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 14316                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 14317                                  
 14318                                  format_special_stuff:
 14319 000014EA 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 14320 000014EF 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 14321 000014F1 53                      		push	bx
 14322 000014F2 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 14323 000014F5 E83D04                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 14324 000014F8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14325 000014F9 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 14326                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14327                                  
 14328                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14329                                  
 14330                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 14331                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 14332                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 14333                                  
 14334                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14335                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 14336 000014FB 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 14337 000014FD 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 14338 000014FF 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 14339 00001500 51                      		push	cx
 14340 00001501 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 14341 00001503 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 14342 00001505 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 14343 00001507 8406[2005]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 14344 0000150B 59                      		pop	cx
 14345 0000150C 58                      		pop	ax
 14346 0000150D 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14347                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 14348 0000150F 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 14349 00001510 06                      		push	es
 14350                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14351 00001511 2EC41E[E614]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 14352                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 14353                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 14354 00001516 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 14355 00001518 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 14356 0000151B 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 14357                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 14358                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 14359 0000151F 07                      		pop	es
 14360 00001520 5B                      		pop	bx
 14361 00001521 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 14362                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14363                                  
 14364                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14365                                  
 14366                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 14367                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 14368                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 14369                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 14370                                  
 14371                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 14372 00001523 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 14373                                  					; read driver parm ?
 14374 00001528 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 14375 0000152A 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 14376                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 14377 0000152F 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14378                                  ps2_30_problem:
 14379 00001531 50                      		push	ax
 14380 00001532 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 14381                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 14382                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14383 00001534 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14384                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 14385                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14386 00001539 58                      		pop	ax
 14387 0000153A EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 14388                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14389                                  
 14390                                  ; 17/10/2022
 14391                                  ; 16/10/2022
 14392                                  
 14393                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 14394                                  
 14395                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 14396                                  
 14397                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 14398                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 14399                                  
 14400                                  		; 19/10/2022
 14401 0000153C 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 14402                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 14403                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 14404 0000153D 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 14405                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 14406                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 14407                                  
 14408                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 14409                                  
 14410 00001542 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 14411 00001545 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14412 00001548 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 14413                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 14414                                  format_special_stuff_done:		
 14415 0000154A 803E[2005]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 14416 0000154F 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 14417                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 14418                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 14419                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 14420 00001551 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14421                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14422                                  		
 14423 00001556 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 14424                                  		
 14425 00001557 803E[2D06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 14426                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 14427 0000155C 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 14428                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 14429                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 14430 0000155E 9D                      		popf
 14431 0000155F 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 14432                                  ret_from_i13:
 14433 00001561 1F                      		pop	ds
 14434 00001562 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 14435                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14436                                  
 14437                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 14438                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 14439                                  ; a changeline error.
 14440                                  
 14441                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:
 14442 00001565 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 14443                                  i13_ret_error:				
 14444 00001567 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 14445 0000156A 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 14446 0000156C 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 14447 0000156E 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 14448 00001570 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 14449 00001575 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 14450                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 14451                                  					; never	would
 14452 00001577 53                      		push	bx
 14453 00001578 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 14454 0000157B E8B703                  		call	set_changed_dl
 14455 0000157E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14456                                  int13b:
 14457 0000157F F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 14458 00001580 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 14459                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14460                                  
 14461                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 14462                                  
 14463                                  goterr13:
 14464 00001582 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 14465 00001585 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 14466                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 14467 00001587 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 14468 0000158A 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 14469 0000158C 803E[2706]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 14470 00001591 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 14471                                  
 14472 00001593 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 14473                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 14474                                  					; (2 = romread)
 14475                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 14476 00001598 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 14477                                  
 14478 0000159A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 14479                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 14480                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14481 0000159C 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14482                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14483                                  					; call far 70:797h
 14484 000015A1 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 14485 000015A4 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 14486 000015A6 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 14487 000015A8 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 14488 000015AA 53                      		push	bx
 14489 000015AB 51                      		push	cx
 14490 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 14491 000015AD A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 14492                                  loop_ecc:
 14493 000015B0 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14494                                  
 14495                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 14496                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 14497                                  ;
 14498                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 14499                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 14500                                  ; track.
 14501                                  ;
 14502                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 14503                                  ; this request.
 14504                                  ;
 14505                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 14506                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 14507                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 14508                                  ;
 14509 000015B3 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 14510                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 14511                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14512 000015B6 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14513                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14514 000015BB 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 14515 000015BD 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 14516 000015C0 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 14517 000015C2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 14518 000015C5 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 14519                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14520                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 14521                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 14522 000015C7 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 14523                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 14524                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 14525                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 14526                                  ok11_op:
 14527 000015C9 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 14528 000015CD 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 14529 000015CF FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 14530                                  					; add 200h to address
 14531 000015D1 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14532 000015D3 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 14533 000015D5 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 14534                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14535                                  
 14536                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 14537                                  
 14538                                  ok11_exit_err:
 14539 000015D7 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 14540                                  ok11_exit:
 14541 000015D8 5A                      		pop	dx
 14542 000015D9 59                      		pop	cx
 14543 000015DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 14544 000015DB EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14545                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14546                                  
 14547                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 14548                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 14549                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 14550                                  
 14551                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 14552 000015DD 06                      		push	es
 14553 000015DE 53                      		push	bx
 14554 000015DF BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14555 000015E2 1E                      		push	ds
 14556 000015E3 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 14557 000015E4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 14558                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 14559                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14560 000015E7 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14561                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14562 000015EC 5B                      		pop	bx
 14563 000015ED 07                      		pop	es
 14564 000015EE 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 14565 000015F0 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 14566 000015F3 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 14567                                  
 14568                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 14569                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 14570                                  
 14571                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 14572 000015F5 56                      		push	si
 14573 000015F6 57                      		push	di
 14574 000015F7 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14575 000015F9 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14576 000015FC E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 14577 000015FF 5F                      		pop	di
 14578 00001600 5E                      		pop	si
 14579 00001601 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14580                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14581                                  
 14582                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14583                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14584                                  
 14585                                  gotdmaerr:
 14586 00001603 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14587 00001606 FB                      		sti
 14588 00001607 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14589 0000160A 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14590                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14591                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14592 0000160C 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14593 0000160F 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14594 00001611 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14595 00001614 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14596 00001616 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14597                                  
 14598                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14599                                  
 14600                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14601                                  
 14602 00001618 52                      		push	dx
 14603 00001619 51                      		push	cx
 14604 0000161A 53                      		push	bx
 14605 0000161B 50                      		push	ax
 14606 0000161C 55                      		push	bp
 14607 0000161D 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14608 0000161F 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14609 00001621 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14610 00001623 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14611 00001625 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14612 00001627 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14613 00001629 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14614 0000162B 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14615                                  
 14616                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14617                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14618                                  
 14619 0000162F 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14620 00001631 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14621                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14622                                  
 14623                                  no_skip_first:
 14624 00001634 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14625 00001636 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14626 00001638 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14627                                  
 14628                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14629                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14630                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14631                                  ;
 14632                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14633                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14634                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14635                                  ; in error.
 14636                                  
 14637 0000163A 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14638 0000163C 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14639                                  
 14640                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14641                                  
 14642 0000163E 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14643                                  					; set up head number
 14644 00001641 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14645 00001644 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14646                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14647                                  
 14648                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 14649 00001647 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14650 00001649 F9                      		stc
 14651 0000164A E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14652                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14653                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14654                                  
 14655                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14656                                  
 14657                                  intverify:
 14658 0000164D 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14659 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14660 0000164F 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14661 00001650 07                      		pop	es
 14662                                  dosimple:
 14663 00001651 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14664                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14665                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14666                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14667 00001654 9A[6907]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14668                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14669 00001659 5B                      		pop	bx
 14670 0000165A 07                      		pop	es
 14671 0000165B E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14672                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14673                                  
 14674                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14675                                  
 14676                                  intformat:
 14677 0000165E 06                      		push	es
 14678 0000165F 53                      		push	bx
 14679 00001660 56                      		push	si
 14680 00001661 57                      		push	di
 14681 00001662 1E                      		push	ds
 14682                                  
 14683                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14684                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14685                                  
 14686 00001663 06                      		push	es
 14687 00001664 1E                      		push	ds
 14688 00001665 07                      		pop	es
 14689 00001666 1F                      		pop	ds
 14690 00001667 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14691 00001669 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14692 0000166C E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14693 0000166F 1F                      		pop	ds
 14694 00001670 5F                      		pop	di
 14695 00001671 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14696 00001672 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14697                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14698                                  
 14699                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14700                                  ; the first block.
 14701                                  ;
 14702                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14703                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14704                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14705                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14706                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14707                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14708                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14709                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14710                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14711                                  
 14712                                  doblock:
 14713                                  
 14714                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14715                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14716                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14717                                  				
 14718 00001674 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14719                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14720 00001677 51                      		push	cx
 14721 00001678 06                      		push	es
 14722 00001679 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14723                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14724 0000167A E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14725 0000167D 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14726                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14727 00001681 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14728                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14729 00001686 5F                      		pop	di
 14730 00001687 07                      		pop	es
 14731 00001688 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14732 0000168A 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14733 0000168C B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14734 0000168E 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14735                                  doblockflop:
 14736 00001690 59                      		pop	cx
 14737                                  doblockcontinue:
 14738 00001691 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14739 00001693 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14740 00001695 50                      		push	ax
 14741 00001696 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14742 00001698 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14743                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14744                                  
 14745                                  doblocklast:
 14746 0000169A 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14747 0000169C 50                      		push	ax
 14748                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 14749 0000169D E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14750 000016A0 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14751 000016A2 58                      		pop	ax
 14752 000016A3 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14753                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14754 000016A6 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14755 000016A8 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14756 000016AA 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14757 000016AC 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14758 000016AE 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14759                                  					; then we are done already.
 14760 000016B0 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14761                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14762 000016B2 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14763 000016B5 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14764                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14765                                  
 14766                                  bufferx:
 14767 000016B7 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14768                                  					; set up head number
 14769                                  buffer:
 14770 000016BA 53                      		push	bx
 14771 000016BB 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14772 000016BE 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14773 000016C1 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14774                                  
 14775                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14776                                  
 14777 000016C3 06                      		push	es
 14778 000016C4 1E                      		push	ds
 14779 000016C5 56                      		push	si
 14780 000016C6 57                      		push	di
 14781 000016C7 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14782 000016C8 06                      		push	es
 14783 000016C9 1F                      		pop	ds
 14784 000016CA 07                      		pop	es
 14785 000016CB BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14786 000016CE 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14787 000016CF 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14788 000016D1 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14789 000016D4 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14790                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14791 000016D5 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14792 000016D6 5E                      		pop	si
 14793 000016D7 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14794                                  
 14795                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14796                                  
 14797 000016D8 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14798                                  					; get drive number
 14799 000016DA 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14800 000016DD E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14801                                  					;
 14802                                  					; ah is	function
 14803                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14804                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14805                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14806                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14807                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14808 000016E0 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14809 000016E3 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14810 000016E4 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14811 000016E6 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14812                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14813                                  
 14814                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14815                                  
 14816                                  doread:
 14817 000016E8 06                      		push	es
 14818 000016E9 53                      		push	bx
 14819 000016EA 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14820 000016EB 07                      		pop	es
 14821 000016EC BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14822 000016EF B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14823 000016F1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14824                                  					; get drive number
 14825 000016F4 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14826                                  					; ah = function
 14827                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14828                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14829                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14830 000016F7 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14831 000016FA 5B                      		pop	bx
 14832 000016FB 07                      		pop	es
 14833 000016FC 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14834 000016FE 56                      		push	si
 14835 000016FF 57                      		push	di
 14836 00001700 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14837 00001702 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14838 00001705 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14839 00001708 5F                      		pop	di
 14840 00001709 5E                      		pop	si
 14841                                  
 14842                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14843                                  
 14844                                  dotail:
 14845 0000170A 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14846 0000170B 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14847 0000170E 41                      		inc	cx
 14848 0000170F 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14849 00001712 F8                      		clc
 14850 00001713 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14851 00001715 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14852                                  
 14853                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14854                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14855                                  
 14856 00001717 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14857 0000171A E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14858 0000171D E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14859                                  
 14860                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14861                                  
 14862                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14863                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14864                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14865                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14866                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14867                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14868                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14869                                  
 14870                                  bad13:
 14871 00001720 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14872 00001722 5D                      		pop	bp
 14873 00001723 5B                      		pop	bx
 14874 00001724 5B                      		pop	bx
 14875 00001725 59                      		pop	cx
 14876 00001726 5A                      		pop	dx
 14877 00001727 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14878 00001729 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14879                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14880                                  
 14881                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:
 14882 0000172C E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14883                                  
 14884                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14885                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14886                                  		;db 	0
 14887                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14888                                  
 14889                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14908                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14909                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14910                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14911                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14912                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14913                                  
 14914                                  install_bds:
 14915 0000173B 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14916 0000173C BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14917                                  
 14918                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14919                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14920                                  loop_next_bds:
 14921 0000173F C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14922                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14923 00001741 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14924 00001745 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14925                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14926 00001748 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14927 0000174A B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14928 0000174C 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14929                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14930 00001750 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14931 00001753 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14932                                  					; we don't own it
 14933 00001758 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14934                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14935 0000175B 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14936 0000175E 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14937                                  next_bds:
 14938                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14939 00001762 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14940 00001765 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14941                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14942                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14943 00001767 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14944 00001769 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14945                                  					; install bds
 14946 0000176C 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14947 0000176E 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14948                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14949                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14950 00001771 1F                      		pop	ds

 15000                                  					; get the drive	letter

 15003                                  ;           then existing dsk is drive A & vice versa
