 19821                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19822                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19823                                  ;
 19824                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19825                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19826                                  ;
 19827                                  ; Inputs : None
 19828                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19829                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19830                                  ;	   free memory.
 19831                                  ;
 19832                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19833                                  ;
 19834                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19835                                  	
 19836                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 19837                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:09A2h)
 19838                                  
 19839                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19840                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19841 000008D8 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19842 000008DB B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC

 19863                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo

 19865                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 19866                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 19867                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 19868                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.

 19890

 19892                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.

 19920                                  ;
 19921                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19922                                  ;
 19923                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19924                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19925                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19926                                  ;
 19927                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19928                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19929                                  ; 
 19930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19931                                  
 19932                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19933                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)

 19939 00000962 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19940                                  
 19941                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19942                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19943                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19944                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19945                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19946                                  	; ds = cs

 19948                                  ;else
 19949                                  ;	..
 19950                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19951

 19953                                  	; ds = cs

 19999

 20328 000009EC B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS

 20346                                  
 20347                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 20348                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 20349                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 20350                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 20351                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 20352                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 20353                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 20354                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 20355                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 20356                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 20357                                  ;	  stub will go.
 20358                                  ;
 20359                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 20360                                  
 20361                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20362                                  update_arena:
 20363 00000A06 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 20364 00000A07 57                      	push	di
 20365 00000A08 51                      	push	cx
 20366 00000A09 52                      	push	dx

 20424                                  ;
 20425                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 20426                                  ;
 20427                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 20428                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 20429                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 20430                                  ;
 20431                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 20432                                  ;
 20433                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20434                                  
 20435                                  AllocHMA:
 20436                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 20437                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 20438                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 20439                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 20440                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 20441                                  
 20442                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 20443                                  ;
 20444                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 20445                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 20446                                  ;	push	ax
 20447                                  ;	popf
 20448                                  ;	pushf
 20449                                  ;	pop	ax
 20450                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 20452                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 20453                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 20454

 20594                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20595                                  ;
 20596                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 20597                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 20598                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 20599                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 20600                                  ;
 20601                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 20602                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 20603                                  ;
 20604                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20605                                  
 20606                                  StartVDHead:
 20607                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 20608                                  
 20609 00000AC6 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 20610 00000ACA 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 20611 00000ACC 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 20612 00000ACE 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 20613 00000AD0 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 20614                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 20615 00000AD1 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 20616                                  VDiskSig1:
 20617 00000AD8 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20618                                  
 20619                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 20620                                  
 20621 00000ADD 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 20622                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 20623 00000AE3 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 20624 00000AF2 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 20625 00000AF4 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 20626                                  VDInt19:
 20627 00000AF5 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 20628                                  OldVDInt19:
 20629 00000AF6 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 20630                                  
 20631                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 20632                                  
 20633                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 20634 00000AFA 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 20635                                  VDiskSig2:
 20636 00000AFD 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 20637                                  
 20638                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 20639                                  
 20640 00000B02 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 20641 00000B05 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 20642 00000B07 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 20643 00000B08 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 20644 00000B0A 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 20645 00000B0B 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 20646 00000B0D 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 20647 00000B0F FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 20648 00000B10 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 20649 00000B12 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 20650 00000B14 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 20651 00000B16 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 20652 00000B18 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 20653                                  
 20654                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte

 20656                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20657                                  ;
 20658                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 20659                                  ;
 20660                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 20661                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 20662                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 20663                                  ;
 20664                                  ; Inputs : None
 20665                                  ;
 20666                                  ; Outputs : None
 20667                                  ;
 20668                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 20669                                  ;
 20670                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20671                                  
 20672                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 20673                                  
 20674                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 20675 00000B1A 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 20676 00000B1C 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 20677                                  
 20678                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 20679                                  
 20680                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20681 00000B1E A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 20682                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 20683 00000B21 2EA3[F60A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 20684 00000B25 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 20685                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20686 00000B28 2EA3[F80A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 20687                                  
 20688                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 20689                                  
 20690 00000B2C B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 20691                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 20692                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20693 00000B2E BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 20694 00000B31 CD21                    	int	21h
 20695                                  
 20696                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 20697                                  
 20698 00000B33 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 20699 00000B34 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 20700                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 20701 00000B36 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 20702                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 20703 00000B3D 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 20704 00000B44 40                      	inc	ax
 20705 00000B45 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 20706                                  
 20707                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 20708                                  
 20709 00000B47 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 20710                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 20711 00000B48 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 20712 00000B4E A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 20713                                  
 20714                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 20715                                  
 20716                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 20717 00000B51 B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 20718 00000B54 BE[C60A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 20719 00000B57 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 20720 00000B59 0E                      	push	cs
 20721 00000B5A 1F                      	pop	ds
 20722 00000B5B FC                      	cld
 20723 00000B5C F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 20724 00000B5E FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 20725                                  
 20726                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 20727                                  
 20728                                  	; 23/10/2022
 20729 00000B5F 57                      	push	di
 20730 00000B60 06                      	push	es
 20731                                  
 20732                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 20733                                  	;mov	es,ax
 20734                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20735 00000B61 49                      	dec	cx
 20736                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 20737 00000B62 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 20738                                  
 20739 00000B64 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 20740                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 20741 00000B67 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 20742 00000B6A BE[FA0A]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 20743 00000B6D F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 20744                                  
 20745 00000B6F 5F                      	pop	di
 20746 00000B70 07                      	pop	es
 20747                                  
 20748 00000B71 C3                      	retn

 20799                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 20800                                  
 20801                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 20802                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20803                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	     ;I070
 20804                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	     ;I070
 20805                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	     ;I070
 20806                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	     ;I070
 20807                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	     ;I070
 20808                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	     ;I070
 20809                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			     ;I070
 20810                                  ;								     ;I070
 20811                                  ;	in      al,64h         		; Test for passwd servr mode ;I070
 20812                                  ;	test    al,10h			; Is keyboard inhibited?     ;I070
 20813                                  ;	jnz     short ClrVDISKok	; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 20814                                  ;					; Check for Tortugas...	     ;I070
 20815                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                	     ;I070
 20816                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h  ; ds = cs       
 20817                                  ;	mov	ax,[sys_model_byte]
 20818                                  ;	cmp	ax,19F8h
 20819                                  ;	je      short ClrVDISKno                            	     ;I070
 20820                                  ;					; Check for mod 30-286	     ;I070
 20821                                  ;	;;cmp	word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh			     ;I070
 20822                                  ;	;cmp	word [sys_model_byte],09FCh	
 20823                                  ;	cmp	ax,09FCh
 20824                                  ;	jne     short ClrVDISKok			      	     ;I070
 20825                                  ;ClrVDISKno:							     ;I070	
 20826                                  ;	retn	               		; Return w/o block move.     ;I070
 20827                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							     ;I070
 20828                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	     ;I070
 20829                                  
 20830                                  	; 12/12/2022
 20831                                  	; ds = cs
 20832                                  
 20833                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 20834                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 20835                                  
 20836 00000BC2 06                      	push	es
 20837 00000BC3 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 20838 00000BC5 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 20839 00000BC7 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 20840 00000BC9 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20841 00000BCB B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20842 00000BCD D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20843 00000BCF 05[A20B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 20844 00000BD2 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 20845                                  
 20846                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 20847                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 20848                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 20849                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 20850                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl

 20870                                  ;
 20871                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 20872                                  ;
 20873                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 20874                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 20875                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 20876                                  ;		the offset.
 20877                                  ;
 20878                                  ; Inputs : ES:DI - pointer to free HMA
 20879                                  ; Output : FreeHMAPtr in BIOS data segment updated
 20880                                  ;
 20881                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 20884                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20887 00000BEE 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 20888                                  	;
 20889 00000BF0 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es
 20890 00000BF2 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 20891                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20892 00000BF5 A2[0D00]                	mov	[inHMA],al ; 0FFh
 20893                                  	;
 20894 00000BF8 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 20895 00000BFA 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round
 20896 00000BFD 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 20897 00000C00 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20898 00000C02 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 20899 00000C04 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 20900                                  	;
 20901                                  	; 03/09/2023
 20902                                  	;push	ds
 20903                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 20904                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h

 20906                                  	; 03/09/2023

 20911 00000C0A 1F                      	pop	ds

 20953                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20954                                  ;
 20955                                  ; procedure : CPMHack
 20956                                  ;
 20957                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 20958                                  ;		for CPM compatibility
 20959                                  ;
 20960                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20961                                  
 20962                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20963                                  CPMHack:
 20964 00000C33 1E                      	push	ds
 20965 00000C34 B9FFFF                  	mov	cx,0FFFFh
 20966 00000C37 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx		; ES = 0FFFFh
 20967                                  	;xor	cx,cx
 20968                                  	; 11/12/2022
 20969 00000C39 41                      	inc	cx  ; cx = 0
 20970 00000C3A 8ED9                    	mov	ds,cx		; DS = 0
 20971 00000C3C BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h
 20972 00000C3F BFD000                  	mov	di,0D0h
 20973                                  	;mov	cx,5
 20974 00000C42 B105                    	mov	cl,5
 20975 00000C44 FC                      	cld
 20976 00000C45 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 20977 00000C47 1F                      	pop	ds
 20978 00000C48 C3                      	retn

 21896                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21897                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21898                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21899                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21900                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21901                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21902                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21903                                  ;
 21904                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21905                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21906                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21907                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21908                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21909                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21910                                  ;
 21911                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21912                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21913                                  ;
 21914                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21915                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21916                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21917                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21918                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21919                                  ;
 21920                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21921                                  ;
 21922                                  ;			  none.
 21923                                  
 21924                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21925                                  ;
 21926                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21927                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21928                                  
 21929                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21930

 22132                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22133                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22134                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 22135                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22136                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 22137                                  ;
 22138                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 22139                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 22140                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 22141                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 22142                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 22143                                  ; program).
 22144                                  
 22145                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 22146                                  
 22147                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 22148                                  
 22149 000010B9 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 22150                                  
 22151                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 22152                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 22153                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 22154                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 22155                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 22156                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 22157                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 22158                                  ; carridge return.
 22159                                  
 22160                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 22161                                  ;character after =.
 22162                                  
 22163 000010BA 06                      	push	es
 22164 000010BB 1E                      	push	ds
 22165 000010BC 07                      	pop	es
 22166 000010BD 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 22167 000010BE 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 22168                                  
 22169 000010C0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 22170 000010C2 FC                      	cld
 22171 000010C3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 22172 000010C9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 22173                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 22174 000010CC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 22175                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22176 000010CD 08C0                    	or	al,al
 22177                                  	;cmp	al,0
 22178 000010CF 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 22179 000010D1 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 22180                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 22181 000010D3 AC                      	lodsb
 22182 000010D4 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 22183 000010D7 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 22184 000010D9 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 22185 000010DB FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 22186 000010DD 47                      	inc	di
 22187 000010DE EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm

 22306                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 22307                                  ;
 22308                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 22309                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 22310                                  ;
 22311                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 22312                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 22313                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 22314                                  
 22315                                  ParaRound:
 22316 00001137 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 22317 0000113A D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 22318 0000113C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22319 0000113E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22320 00001140 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 22321 00001142 C3                      	retn

 22323                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22324                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 22325                                  ;
 22326                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 22327                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 22328                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 22329                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 22330                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 22331                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 22332                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 22333                                  ;
 22334                                  ;in: after relocation,
 22335                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 22336                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 22337                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 22338                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 22339                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 22340                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset value of end of sysinit module label
 22341                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 22342                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 22343                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 22344                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 22345                                  ;
 22346                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 22347                                  
 22348                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22349                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22350                                  sysinit_base:				
 22351 00001143 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 22352 00001148 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 22353 0000114D CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 22354 0000114F 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 22355 00001154 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 22356 00001159 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 22357 0000115A 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 22358 0000115B 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 22359                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 22360                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 22361 0000115D E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 22362 00001160 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 22363 00001165 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 22364                                  
 22365                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 22366                                  
 22367 00001167 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 22368 00001169 0E                      	push	cs
 22369 0000116A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22370                                  	; 30/12/2022
 22371                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 22372                                  	;mov	dx, 102
 22373 0000116B BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 22374                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 22375 0000116E CD21                    	int	21h
 22376                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 22377                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 22378                                  
 22379                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 22380                                  stall:
 22381                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22382                                  _stall: 
 22383                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22384 00001170 F4                      	hlt 
 22385                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22386                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 22387 00001171 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 22388                                  
 22389                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 22390 00001173 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 22391                                  
 22392                                  ;-------------------------------------
 22393                                  
 22394                                  sum_up:
 22395                                  
 22396                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 22397                                  ;out:  ax - result
 22398                                  ;
 22399                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 22400                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 22401                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 22402                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 22403                                  ;
 22404                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 22405                                  
 22406 00001178 1E                      	push	ds
 22407                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 22408                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 22409 00001179 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 22410                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22411                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 22412 0000117D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 22413 0000117F 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 22414 00001181 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22415 00001183 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 22416                                  					; whole test better fail.
 22417 00001188 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 22418 0000118A 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 22419                                  sum1:
 22420 0000118C 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 22421 0000118E 46                      	inc	si
 22422 0000118F 46                      	inc	si
 22423 00001190 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 22424                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 22425                                  sum_sys_code:
 22426                                  	; 24/10/2022
 22427 00001192 BE9211                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22428                                  			    ; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22429                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 22430                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 22431                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 22432                                  	; 02/11/2022
 22433                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 22434                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 22435 00001195 B9[604D]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 22436 00001198 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 22437 0000119A D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 22438                                  sum2:
 22439 0000119C 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 22440 0000119F 46                      	inc	si
 22441 000011A0 46                      	inc	si
 22442 000011A1 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 22443 000011A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 22444 000011A4 C3                      	retn
 22445                                  
 22446                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22447                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22448                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 22449                                  
 22450                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 22451                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h) 	
 22452 000011A5 0000                    	dw	0
 22453                                  sysinit_base_sp equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 63 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1161h)
 22454                                  ;SYSINIT:11BFh:			    ; = 64 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1292h)
 22455 000011A7 0000                    	dw	0

 22470                                  ; Set_Buffer
 22471                                  ;
 22472                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 22473                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 22474                                  ;
 22475                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 22476                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 22477                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 22478                                  ;
 22479                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 22480                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.

 22503 000011D9 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]

 22505

 22507                                  
 22508                                  nxt_buff:

 22510 000011E2 89C7                    	mov	di,ax

 22512                                  
 22513 000011E6 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 22514

 22516                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 22517 000011EC 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 22518 000011EF 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 22519                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 22520                                  	; 25/10/2022

 22522

 22524 000011F7 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no

 22526 000011F9 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 22527 000011FD 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff

 22546                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22547                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 22548                                  ;
 22549                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 22550                                  ;
 22551                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 22552                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 22553                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22554                                  
 22555                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 22556                                  GetBufferAddr:
 22557 0000121E 53                      	push	bx
 22558 0000121F 52                      	push	dx
 22559 00001220 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 22560 00001224 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 22561                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 22562 00001229 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 22563                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22564                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 22565                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22566 0000122C 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 22567 0000122E 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22568 00001230 B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 22569                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 22570 00001233 CD2F                    	int	2Fh
 22571 00001235 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 22572 00001238 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 22573                                  
 22574                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 22575                                  	; 05/09/2023
 22576                                  	; zf=1
 22577 0000123A 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 22578                                  	; zf=1
 22579                                  	
 22580                                  	;zf=1
 22581                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 22582                                  	;zf=1
 22583 0000123B 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 22584                                  got_hma:
 22585 00001240 5A                      	pop	dx
 22586 00001241 5B                      	pop	bx
 22587 00001242 C3                      	retn

 22610 00001258 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 22611                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 22612 0000125E 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0

 22614 00001264 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0

 22617                                  ; ======================================================================
 22618                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 22619                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22620                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22621                                  
 22622                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22623                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 22624                                  ;
 22625                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 22626                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 22627                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 22628                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 22629                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 22630                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 22631                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 22632                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 22633                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 22634                                  ;
 22635                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 22636                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 22637                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 22638                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 22639                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 22640                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 22641                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 22642                                  ;	conditions:
 22643                                  ;
 22644                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 22645                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 22646                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 22647                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 22648                                  ;
 22649                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 22650                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 22651                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 22652                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 22653                                  ;
 22654                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 22655                                  ;
 22656                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 22657                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 22658                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 22659                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 22660                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 22661                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 22662                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 22663                                  ;	interrupt line.
 22664                                  ;
 22665                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 22666                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 22667                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 22668                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 22669                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement stack logic in this case.
 22670                                  ;
 22671                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 22672                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 22673                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 22674                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 22675                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 22676                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 22677                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 22678                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 22679                                  ;
 22680                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 22681                                  
 22682                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22683                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 22684                                  
 22685                                  	; 14/12/2022
 22686                                  stackinit:
 22687 0000126B 50                      	push	ax
 22688 0000126C 1E                      	push	ds
 22689 0000126D 06                      	push	es
 22690 0000126E 53                      	push	bx
 22691 0000126F 51                      	push	cx
 22692 00001270 52                      	push	dx
 22693 00001271 57                      	push	di
 22694 00001272 56                      	push	si
 22695 00001273 55                      	push	bp
 22696                                  
 22697                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 22698                                  
 22699                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22700                                  	; ds = cs
 22701 00001274 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 22702 00001277 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 22703                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22704                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 22705                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 22706 00001279 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 22707                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 22708 0000127D A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 22709 00001280 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 22710                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22711 00001284 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 22712                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22713                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22714                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 22715 00001287 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 22716                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22717 0000128B 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 22718 0000128D A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 22719                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 22720                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 22721                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 22722 00001290 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 22723                                  
 22724                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 22725                                  
 22726                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 22727                                  
 22728                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 22729                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22730                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 22731 00001294 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 22732                                  
 22733                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 22734                                  
 22735 00001299 B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 22736                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 22737                                  	; 12/12/2022
 22738                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 22739 0000129C F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22740 0000129E 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 22741 000012A0 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 22742 000012A4 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 22743 000012A6 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 22744                                  
 22745                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 22746                                  
 22747 000012A9 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 22748 000012AE 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 22749 000012B2 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 22750 000012B4 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 22751 000012B6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 22752 000012B8 06                      	push	es
 22753 000012B9 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 22754                                  
 22755                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 22756                                  
 22757 000012BA 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 22758 000012BE FC                      	cld
 22759 000012BF F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 22760                                  
 22761 000012C1 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 22762                                  
 22763                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 22764                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 22765                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 22766                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 22767                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 22768                                  
 22769                                  buildloop:
 22770                                  	; 11/12/2022
 22771                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 22772                                  	; 25/10/2022

 22801 000012FB 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 22802

 23524                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23525                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23526                                  
 23527                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23528                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 23529                                  
 23530                                  new_init_loop:
 23531                                  
 23532                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 23533                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 23534                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 23535                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 23536                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 23537                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 23538                                  
 23539 0000145D 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 23540 00001460 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 23541 00001462 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 23542 00001466 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 23543                                  
 23544 00001469 1E                      	push	ds
 23545                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 23546                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 23547                                  	; 21/10/2022
 23548 0000146A B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 23549 0000146D 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 23550 0000146F 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 23551 00001472 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 23552 00001474 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 23553 00001478 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 23554 0000147B 1F                      	pop	ds
 23555                                  
 23556 0000147C 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 23557 0000147F 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 23558 00001483 C3                      	retn
 23559                                  
 23560                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 23561                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23562                                  
 23563                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23564                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 23565                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 23566                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 23567                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 23568                                  ;out: devmark established.
 23569                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 23570                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 23571                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23572                                  
 23573                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23574                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 23575                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 23576                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 23577                                  
 23578                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 23579                                  
 23580                                  setdevmark:
 23581                                  
 23582                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23583                                  	;push	es
 23584                                  	;push	cx
 23585                                  
 23586 00001484 2E8B0E[6403]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 23587 00001489 2E890E[A714]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 23588 0000148E 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 23589                                  	; 25/10/2022
 23590                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 23591 00001490 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 23592 00001494 41                      	inc	cx
 23593                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 23594 00001495 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 23595                                  
 23596                                  	; 04/09/2023
 23597                                  	;pop	cx
 23598                                  	;pop	es
 23599                                  	
 23600 0000149A 2EFF06[6403]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 23601 0000149F C3                      	retn
