 23802                                  
 23803                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23804                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 23805                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 23806                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 23807                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23808                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 23809                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 23810                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 23811                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 23812                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 23813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23814                                  
 23815                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 23816                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 23817 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 23818 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 23819 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 23820                                  endstruc
 23821                                  
 23822                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 23823                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 23824                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 23825                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 23826                                  
 23827                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23828                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 23829                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 23830                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 23831                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 23832                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 23833                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 23834                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 23835                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 23836                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 23837                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 23838                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23839                                  
 23840                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 23841                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 23842 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 23843 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 23844 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 23845                                  endstruc
 23846                                  
 23847                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23848                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 23849                                  ;
 23850                                  ;
 23851                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 23852                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 23853                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23854                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23855                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 23856                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23857                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23858                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23859                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23860                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23861                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 23862                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 23863                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 23864                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 23865                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 23866                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 23867                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 23868                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 23869                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 23870                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 23871                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 23872                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 23873                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 23874                                  ;	   :
 23875                                  ;
 23876                                  ;Note:
 23877                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 23878                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 23879                                  ;
 23880                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 23881                                  ;
 23882                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 23883                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 23884                                  ;
 23885                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 23886                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 23887                                  ;
 23888                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 23889                                  ;
 23890                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 23891                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 23892                                  ;
 23893                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23894                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 23895                                  ;
 23896                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 23897                                  ;
 23898                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 23899                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 23900                                  ;
 23901                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23902                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23903                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23904                                  ;
 23905                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 23906                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 23907                                  ;
 23908                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 23909                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 23910                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 23911                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23912                                  
 23913                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 23914                                  
 23915                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 23916                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 23917                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23918                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23919                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23920                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23921                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23922                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23923                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23924                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23925                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23926                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23927                                  
 23928                                  ;**** Function flags
 23929                                  
 23930                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23931                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23932                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23933                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23934                                  
 23935                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23936                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23937 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23938 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23939 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23940 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23941 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23942 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23943                                  endstruc
 23944                                  
 23945                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23946                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23947                                  ;
 23948                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23949                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23950                                  ;	     +-
 23951                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23952                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23953                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23954                                  ;	     |	:
 23955                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23956                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23957                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23958                                  ;	     |	:
 23959                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23960                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23961                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23962                                  ;	     +-	:
 23963                                  ;
 23964                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23965                                  ;
 23966                                  ;Note:
 23967                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23968                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23969                                  ;
 23970                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23971                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23972                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23973                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23974                                  
 23975                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23976                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23977                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23978                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23979                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23980                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23981                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23982                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23983                                  
 23984                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23985 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23986 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23987 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23988 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23989 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23990                                  endstruc
 23991                                  
 23992                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23993                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23994                                  ;
 23995                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23996                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23997                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23998                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23999                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 24000                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 24001                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 24002                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 24003                                  ;
 24004                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 24005                                  ;
 24006                                  ;            +-
 24007                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 24008                                  ;	    | or
 24009                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 24010                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 24011                                  ;	    | or
 24012                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 24013                                  ;	    | or
 24014                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 24015                                  ;	    | or
 24016                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 24017                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 24018                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 24019                                  ;	    | or
 24020                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 24021                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 24022                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 24023                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 24024                                  ;	    +-
 24025                                  ;
 24026                                  ;
 24027                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 24028                                  ;      list.
 24029                                  ;
 24030                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 24031                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 24032                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 24033                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24034

 24039 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 24040 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 24041                                  endstruc

 24154                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 24155                                  ; ======================================================================
 24156                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24157                                  
 24158                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24159                                  ; SysParse;
 24160                                  ;
 24161                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 24162                                  ;
 24163                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 24164                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 24165                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 24166                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 24167                                  ;
 24168                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 24169                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 24170                                  ;		 is in DS.
 24171                                  ;
 24172                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 24173                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 24174                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 24175                                  ;
 24176                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 24177                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 24178                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 24179                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 24180                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 24181                                  ;
 24182                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 24183                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 24184                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 24185                                  ;
 24186                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 24187                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 24188                                  ;
 24189                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 24190                                  ;
 24191                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 24192                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 24193                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 24194                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 24195                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 24196                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 24197                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 24198                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 24199                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 24200                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 24201                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 24202                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 24203                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 24204                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 24205                                  ;	     (tm08)
 24206                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 24207                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 24208                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 24209                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 24210                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 24211                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 24212                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 24213                                  ;					  (tm12)
 24214                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 24215                                  ;					  (tm13)
 24216                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 24217                                  ;					  (tm14)
 24218                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 24219                                  ;					  (tm15)
 24220                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 24221                                  
 24222                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 24223                                  
 24224                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 24225                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 24226                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 24227                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 24228                                  
 24229                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 24230                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 24231                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 24232                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 24233                                  ;
 24234                                  
 24235                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 24236                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 24237                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 24238                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 24239                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 24240                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 24241                                  
 24242                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 24243                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 24244                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 24245                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 24246                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 24247                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 24248                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 24249                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 24250                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 24251                                  
 24252                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 24253                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 24254                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 24255                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 24256                                  ;	     segment.
 24257                                  
 24258                                  ;  9/16/87 : Ed K (;AN023;) PTM1040
 24259                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 24260                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 24261                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 24262                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 24263                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 24264

 24855                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24856                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 24857                                  ;
 24858                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 24859                                  ;
 24860                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 24861                                  ;	    AL = type
 24862                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 24863                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 24864                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 24865                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 24866                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 24867                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 24868                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 24869                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24870                                  ;
 24871                                  ; Output:   None
 24872                                  ;
 24873                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 24874                                  ;
 24875                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 24876                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24877                                  
 24878                                  _$P_Fill_Result:
 24879 00001767 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24880 00001768 268B7F04                	mov	di,[es:bx+_$P_Control_Blk.Result_Buf]
 24881                                  					;AN000; di points to result buffer
 24882 0000176C 2E893E[B514]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DX],di		;AC034; set returned result address
 24883                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type],al ;AN000; store type
 24884                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag
 24885                                  	; 07/09/2023
 24886                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Type], ax
 24887 00001771 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax		; store type (al) and item tag (ah)
 24888                                  
 24889 00001774 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;

 24968                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 24969                                  ;
 24970                                  ; Function:  Check the match_flags and make the exit code and set the
 24971                                  ;	     result buffer
 24972                                  ;

 24974                                  ;		Complex

 24976                                  ;		Time

 24982                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF

 25094                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 25095                                  ;
 25096                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 25097                                  ;
 25098                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 25099                                  ;
 25100                                  ; Output:   None
 25101                                  ;
 25102                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 25103                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25104                                  
 25105                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 25106 00001894 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25107 00001895 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25108                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 25109 00001896 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25110 00001899 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25111 0000189B 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 25112                                  
 25113 0000189D 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 25114 0000189F 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 25115                                  
 25116 000018A1 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 25117 000018A6 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 25118                                  
 25119 000018A8 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 25120 000018AC EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 25121                                  
 25122                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 25123 000018AE E81204                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 25124 000018B1 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 25125                                  
 25126 000018B3 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 25127                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 25128 000018B4 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 25129 000018B5 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25130                                  
 25131                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 25132 000018B7 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25133 000018B8 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25134 000018B9 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25136                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25137                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 25138                                  ;
 25139                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 25140                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 25141                                  ;
 25142                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 25143                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 25144                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 25145                                  ;
 25146                                  ; Output:   None
 25147                                  ;
 25148                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 25149                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25150                                  
 25151                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 25152 000018BA 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25153 000018BB 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25154 000018BC 88C2                    	mov	dl,al			;AN000; save info id
 25155                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 25156 000018BE 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 25157 000018C1 E8FF03                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 25158 000018C4 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 25159                                  
 25160 000018C6 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 25161 000018C8 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 25162                                  
 25163 000018CA E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 25164 000018CD 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 25165 000018D0 EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 25166                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;
 25167 000018D2 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip DBCS leading and trailing byte
 25168                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;
 25169 000018D3 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si point to next byte
 25170 000018D4 EBE8                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25171                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;
 25172 000018D6 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 25173 000018D7 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25174 000018D8 C3                      	retn

 25178                                  ;

 25183                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table

 25248                                  
 25249                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used as the base of the XLAT table, provided
 25250                                  ; by the previous GET COUNTRY INFO DOS call. This usage of ES is made

 25269                                  
 25270                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25271                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 25272                                  ;
 25273                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 25274                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 25275                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 25276                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 25277                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 25278                                  ;
 25279                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 25280                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 25281                                  ;
 25282                                  ; Output:    None
 25283                                  ;
 25284                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 25285                                  ;
 25286                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 25287                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25288                                  
 25289                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25290                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 25291                                  
 25292                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25293                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 25294                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 25295 00001916 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25296 00001917 2E800E[BD14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 25297 0000191D 2E8026[BD14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 25298                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 25299 00001923 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 25300 00001926 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 25301 00001928 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 25302                                  
 25303 0000192A 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 25304 0000192C 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 25305                                  
 25306 0000192E 2E800E[BD14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 25307                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 25308 00001934 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 25309                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 25310 00001935 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 25311 00001938 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 25312 00001939 C3                      	retn
 25313                                  
 25314                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25315                                  
 25316                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25317                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 25318                                  
 25319                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25320                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 25321 0000193A 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 25322 0000193B 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 25323 0000193C 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 25324 0000193D 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 25325 0000193E 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 25326 00001940 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 25327 00001942 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 25328                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 25329 00001943 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 25330 00001946 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 25331 00001948 743C                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 25332                                  
 25333 0000194A E8E000                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 25334 0000194D 7233                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 25335                                  
 25336 0000194F 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 25337 00001951 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 25338                                  
 25339                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25340                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 25341                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023 
 25342                                  %if 0
 25343                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x
 25344                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25345                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25346                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25347                                  
 25348                                  	mov	bx,dx			;AN000; save low(2*x)
 25349                                  	mov	ax,cx			;AN000; save high(2*x)
 25350                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 4*x
 25351                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25352                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25353                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25354                                  
 25355                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 8*x
 25356                                  	rcl	cx,1			;AN000; shift left w/ carry
 25357                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25358                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25359                                  
 25360                                  	add	dx,bx			;AN000; now have 10*x
 25361                                  	adc	cx,ax			;AN000; 32bit ADD
 25362                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25363                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25364                                  
 25365                                  	add	dx,bp			;AN000; Add the current one degree decimal
 25366                                  	adc	cx,0			;AN000; if carry, add 1 to high 16bit
 25367                                  	call	_$P_Check_OVF		;AN000; Overflow occurred ?
 25368                                  	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000; then error, exit
 25369                                  
 25370                                  	inc	si			;AN000; update pointer
 25371                                  	jmp	short _$P_Value_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 25372                                  ;_$P_Value_Err0:
 25373                                  %endif
 25374                                  ;****
 25375                                  %if 1
 25376                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25377                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2130h)
 25378

 25381 00001957 E81C00                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow

 25383 0000195C 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx
 25384 0000195E E81500                  	call	_$P_Value_2x_OVF 	; multiply cx:dx by 2 and then check overflow

 25573                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25574                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 25575                                  ;
 25576                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 25577                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 25578                                  ;
 25579                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 25580                                  ;
 25581                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 25582                                  ;
 25583                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 25584                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25585                                  
 25586                                  	; 26/10/2022
 25587                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 25588 00001A1B 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 25589 00001A1C 2EF606[BD14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 25590 00001A22 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 25591                                  
 25592 00001A24 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 25593 00001A25 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25594                                  
 25595                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 25596 00001A26 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 25597 00001A27 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 25598                                  
 25599 00001A29 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 25600 00001A2A C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 25601                                  
 25602                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 25603 00001A2B F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 25604 00001A2C C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 25605                                  
 25606                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25607                                  ; _$P_0099;
 25608                                  ;
 25609                                  ; Function:  Make ASCII 0-9 to Binary 0-9
 25610                                  ;
 25611                                  ; Input:     AL = character code
 25612                                  ;
 25613                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 : AL is not number
 25614                                  ;	     CY = 0 : AL contains binary value
 25615                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25616                                  
 25617                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25618                                  %if 0
 25619                                  _$P_0099:
 25620                                  	cmp	al,"0"                  ;AN000;
 25621                                  	;jb	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9
 25622                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25623                                  	jb	short _$P_0099Err2  ; cf=1
 25624                                  
 25625                                  	cmp	al,"9"                  ;AN000;
 25626                                  	ja	short _$P_0099Err	;AN000; must be 0 =< al =< 9
 25627                                  
 25628                                  	sub	al,"0"                  ;AN000; make char -> bin
 25629                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25630                                  	; cf=0	
 25631                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate no error
 25632                                  	retn				;AN000;
 25633                                  
 25634                                  _$P_0099Err:				;AN000;
 25635                                  	stc				;AN000; indicate error
 25636                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 12/12/2022	
 25637                                  	retn				;AN000;
 25638                                  %endif
 25639                                  
 25640                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 25641                                  %if 1
 25642                                  _$P_0099:
 25643 00001A2D 3C30                    	cmp	al,"0"                  ; cmp al,30h
 25644 00001A2F 7207                    	jb	short _$P_0099Err	; must be 0 =< al =< 9
 25645 00001A31 3C3A                    	cmp	al,"9"+1                ; cmp al,3Ah  
 25646 00001A33 F5                      	cmc				; cf=0 -> cf=1
 25647 00001A34 7202                    	jb	short _$P_0099Err

 25649                                  	; cf=0
 25650                                  _$P_0099Err:	; cf=1
 25651 00001A38 C3                      	retn

 26225                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 26226                                  ;
 26227                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 26228                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 26229                                  ;	    blanks.
 26230                                  ;

 26232                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 26233                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List

 26236                                  ;	    SI points to the next character

 26238                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26239                                   
 26240                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26241                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 26242                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 26243                                  
 26244                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 26245 00001C5C 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 26246 00001C5D 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;

 26259

 26261                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 26262                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 26263                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 26264                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 26265                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 26266                                  %if 0
 26267                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26268                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;

 26274

 26277                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF

 26279                                  %endif
 26280                                  
 26281                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;

 26285

 26287 00001C7D 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 26288                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 26289 00001C7F 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 26290                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list

 26326                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26327                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 26328                                  ;
 26329                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 26330                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 26331                                  ;
 26332                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 26333                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 26334                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 26335                                  ;
 26336                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set) if AL is switch character, and not in first
 26337                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 26338                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 26339                                  
 26340                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 26341                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 26342                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 26343                                  ;
 26344                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 26345                                  
 26346                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 26347                                  ;***********************************************************************
 26348                                  
 26349                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 26350                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 26351                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 26352                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26353 00001CAA BD[C614]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 26354                                  
 26355                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 26356 00001CAD 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 26357 00001CAF 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 26358                                  
 26359                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 26360 00001CB1 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26361 00001CB3 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 26362                                  
 26363 00001CB5 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 26364                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26365                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26366 00001CB6 C3                      	retn
 26367                                  
 26368                                  ; 12/12/2022
 26369                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 26370                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 26371                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 26372                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 26373                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 26374                                  
 26375                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 26376                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 26377 00001CB7 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 26378 00001CB9 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 26379                                  
 26380 00001CBB 2E800E[BD14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 26381                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26382                                  
 26383                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26384                                  	; cf=0
 26385                                  	;retn
 26386                                  
 26387                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 26388                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26389                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 26390 00001CC1 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 26391                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 26392                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 26393 00001CC2 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 26395                                  ;**************************************************************************
 26396                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26397                                  ;
 26398                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 26399                                  ;
 26400                                  ;  Input:
 26401                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 26402                                  ;
 26403                                  ;  Output:
 26404                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 26405                                  ;
 26406                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 26407                                  ;
 26408                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 26409                                  ;***************************************************************************
 26410                                  
 26411                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 26412 00001CC3 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 26413 00001CC4 56                      	push	si			;AN000;

 26419 00001CCB 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 26420 00001CCD 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 26421 00001CCF 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 26422 00001CD0 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26423 00001CD1 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 26424 00001CD2 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 26425 00001CD3 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 26426 00001CD4 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 26427 00001CD5 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 26428                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 26429                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 26430 00001CD6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 26431 00001CD8 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 26432 00001CDB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 26433                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 26434 00001CDD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26435 00001CDF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26436 00001CE1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 26437 00001CE2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 26438 00001CE3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 26439 00001CE4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 26440 00001CE5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 26441 00001CE6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 26442 00001CE7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 26443 00001CE8 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 26444                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 26445 00001CEA 2E8936[B814]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 26446 00001CEF 2E891E[BA14]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 26447                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 26448                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 26449                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 26450                                  	; 08/07/2023
 26451 00001CF4 2EC536[B814]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 26452                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 26453 00001CF9 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 26454 00001CFC 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 26455 00001CFE 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 26456 00001D00 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 26457 00001D02 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 26458 00001D05 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 26459 00001D07 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 26460 00001D08 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 26461                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 26462 00001D0A 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 26463 00001D0B 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 26464                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 26465 00001D0C EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 26466                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 26467                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26468                                  	; cf=0
 26469                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 26470                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 26471 00001D0E 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 26472 00001D0F 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;

 26497 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer

 26501

 26505                                  endstruc

 26511 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 26512 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 26513                                  .size:
 26514                                  endstruc

 27041                                  
 27042                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 27043                                  ;
 27044                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 27045                                  ;
 27046                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27047                                  ;
 27048                                  ;   Modification log:
 27049                                  ;
 27050                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 27051                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 27052                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 27053                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 27054                                  ;
 27055                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27056                                  ;
 27057                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 27058                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 27059                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 27060                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 27061                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 27062                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 27063                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 27064                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 27065                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 27066                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 27067                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 27068                                  ;
 27069                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27070                                  
 27071                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 27072                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 27073                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 27074                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 27075                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 27076                                  
 27077                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 27078                                  
 27079                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 27080                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 27081                                  
 27082                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 27083                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 27084                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 27085                                  
 27086                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 27087                                  ;
 27088                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 27089                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 27090                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 if the user has specified /S on the command-
 27091                                  ;	           line.
 27092                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 27093                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 27094                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 27095                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 27096                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 27097                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 27098                                  ;	          will be set to 1. All others will be set to 0.
 27099                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 27100                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 27101                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 27102                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 27103                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 27104                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 27105                                  ;	           for details).
 27106                                  
 27107 00001F11 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 27108 00001F12 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 27109 00001F13 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 27110 00001F15 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 27111 00001F16 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 27112 00001F26 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 27113 00001F46 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 27114 00001F47 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 27115 00001F48 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 27116                                  
 27117                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 27118                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 27119                                  
 27120                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 27121                                  
 27122                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27123                                  
 27124                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****

 27128                                  
 27129                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27130                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 27131                                  
 27132                                  		;public	DevEntry
 27133                                  
 27134 00001F49 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded (paras)
 27135 00001F4B 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 27136 00001F4D 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 27137 00001F4F 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 27138 00001F53 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 27139                                  ; 30/12/2022
 27140                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 27141 00001F57 00                      ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 style) InitDevLoad?
 27142                                  ;
 27143 00001F58 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 27144 00001F59 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; current UMB used for loading devices (paras)
 27145 00001F5B 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 27146 00001F5D 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free mem blk in the current UMB (paras)
 27147                                  ;
 27148 00001F5F 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 27149                                  ;
 27150 00001F63 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 27151 00001F65 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 27152                                  ;
 27153 00001F67 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whether the current device
 27154                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 27155 00001F68 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 27156                                  ;
 27157 00001F6A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12h ?
 27158 00001F6B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12h ram)
 27159 00001F6D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$' ; 3Com Device name
 27160                                  ;
