 27175                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27176                                  ; (SYSINIT:215Eh)
 27177                                  
 27178                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27179                                  ;
 27180                                  ; procedure : doconf
 27181                                  ;
 27182                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 27183                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 27184                                  ;
 27185                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27186                                  
 27187                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27188                                  doconf:
 27189 00001F7D 0E                      	push	cs
 27190 00001F7E 1F                      	pop	ds
 27191                                  
 27192 00001F7F B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 27193                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 27194 00001F82 CD21                    	int	21h
 27195 00001F84 8816[2646]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 27196                                  
 27197                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21  IO.SYS)
 27198                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27199                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27200                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 27201 00001F88 8816[2446]              	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 27202                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27203                                  
 27204 00001F8C BA[3B45]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ; now pointing to file description
 27205 00001F8F B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 27206                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		; open file "config.sys"
 27207 00001F92 F9                      	stc				; in case of int 24h
 27208 00001F93 CD21                    	int	21h			; function request
 27209 00001F95 7309                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 27210                                  
 27211                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27212                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27213                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27214 00001F97 E8F418                  	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 27215                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 27216                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 27217 00001F9A C606[CD02]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 27218 00001F9F C3                      	retn
 27219                                  noprob: 				; get file size (note < 64k!!)
 27220 00001FA0 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 27221 00001FA2 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			; 0
 27222 00001FA4 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; 0
 27223                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 27224 00001FA6 B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 27225 00001FA9 CD21                    	int	21h
 27226 00001FAB A3[5603]                	mov	[count],ax		; dx:ax = file size ; 08/09/2023
 27227                                  					; 08/09/2023 - Erdogan Tan - Note:
 27228 00001FAE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; dx already must be 0 here ; 08/09/2023
 27229                                  					; I am not removing 'xor dx,dx' here
 27230                                  					; for MSDOS compatibility.
 27231                                  					; ((Also PCDOS 7.1 has 'xor dx,dx' here))
 27232                                  					; (Error will be same if CONGIG.SYS file
 27233                                  					;  size > 64KB) 
 27234                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 27235 00001FB0 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 27236 00001FB3 CD21                    	int	21h
 27237                                  
 27238                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 
 27239 00001FB5 8B16[A502]              	mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 27240                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27241                                  	;mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 27242                                  
 27243 00001FB9 A1[5603]                	mov	ax,[count]
 27244 00001FBC A3[D002]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 27245 00001FBF E875F1                  	call	ParaRound
 27246 00001FC2 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 27247                                  
 27248                                  ; 31/12/2022
 27249                                  ; 27/10/2022
 27250                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27251                                  ;
 27252                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 27253                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 27254                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 27255                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 27256                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 27257                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 27258                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 27259                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 27260                                  ;
 27261 00001FC4 4A                      	dec	dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 27262 00001FC5 8916[A214]              	mov	[config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 27263 00001FC9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 27264                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 27265                                  
 27266 00001FCB 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 27267                                  	
 27268                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27269 00001FCE 8916[A502]              	mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 27270 00001FD2 8916[A302]              	mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 27271                                  	
 27272                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27273                                  	;mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 27274                                  	;call    TempCDS 
 27275                                  	; 31/12/2022
 27276                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27277                                  	; ds <> cs 
 27278                                  	;mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]	
 27279                                  
 27280                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27281                                  	; ds = cs
 27282 00001FD6 8B0E[5603]              	mov	cx,[count]
 27283                                  
 27284 00001FDA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 27285 00001FDC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 27286                                  
 27287 00001FDE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 27288                                  	; 08/09/2023
 27289                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:count]
 27290 00001FE0 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 27291                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 27292 00001FE2 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 27293 00001FE3 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 27294 00001FE5 9C                      	pushf
 27295                                  
 27296                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 27297                                  
 27298 00001FE6 50                      	push	ax
 27299 00001FE7 57                      	push	di
 27300 00001FE8 51                      	push	cx
 27301 00001FE9 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 27302 00001FEB 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 27303 00001FED E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 27304 00001FEF F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 27305 00001FF1 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 27306                                  
 27307                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 27308                                  
 27309 00001FF3 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 27310                                  
 27311                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 27312                                  
 27313                                  puteol:
 27314 00001FF4 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 27315 00001FF6 AA                      	stosb
 27316 00001FF7 B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 27317 00001FF9 AA                      	stosb
 27318 00001FFA 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 27319                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27320                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 27321                                  
 27322                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 27323                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 27324 00001FFC 0E                      	push	cs
 27325 00001FFD 1F                      	pop	ds
 27326                                  
 27327 00001FFE 893E[5603]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 27328                                  
 27329 00002002 59                      	pop	cx
 27330 00002003 5F                      	pop	di
 27331 00002004 58                      	pop	ax
 27332                                  
 27333                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27334                                  	; 27/10/2022
 27335                                  	;push	cs
 27336                                  	;pop	ds
 27337                                  
 27338 00002005 50                      	push	ax
 27339                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 27340 00002006 B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 27341 00002008 CD21                    	int	21h
 27342 0000200A 58                      	pop	ax
 27343 0000200B 9D                      	popf
 27344 0000200C 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;we've got a problem
 27345 0000200E 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax			; if ax <(>) cx
 27346 00002010 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 27347                                  conferr:
 27348 00002012 BA[3B45]                	mov	dx,config		;print config error
 27349 00002015 E87924                  	call	badfil
 27350                                  	; 17/09/2023
 27351                                  endconv:	; 01/01/2023
 27352 00002018 C3                      	retn
 27353

 27356                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 27357                                  ;
 27358                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands

 27430 00002063 50                              push    ax                      ;
 27431 00002064 E8B121                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 27432 00002067 88C4                            mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 27433 00002069 E8AC21                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 27434 0000206C 86C4                            xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next

 27437                                  ;
 27438                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 27439                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 27440                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 27441                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 27442                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 27443                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 27444                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 27445                                  ;   spot.
 27446                                  ;
 27447                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 27448                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 27449                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 27450                                  ;   retrieved.
 27451                                  ;
 27452 00002072 803E[CD02]02                    cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?

 27648                                  ; buffer command
 27649                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27650                                  
 27651                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27652                                  ;									      *
 27653                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 27654                                  ;									      *
 27655                                  ; input :								      *
 27656                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27657                                  ; output:								      *
 27658                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 27659                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 27660                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 27661                                  ;									      *
 27662                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27663                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27664                                  ; logic:								      *
 27665                                  ; {									      *
 27666                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 27667                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27668                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 27669                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27670                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27671                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27672                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 27673                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 27674                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 27675                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 27676                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 27677                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 27678                                  ;	};								      *
 27679                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 27680                                  ; };									      *
 27681                                  ;									      *
 27682                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27683                                  
 27684                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27685                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)
 27686                                  tryb:
 27687 0000213E 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'
 27688 00002141 755C                    	jne	short tryc
 27689                                  
 27690                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27691                                  ; (SYSINIT:24BFh)
 27692                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27693                                  ;%if 0
 27694                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 27695 00002143 E83F1F                  	call	query_user		; query the user if config_cmd
 27696 00002146 7257                    	jc	short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 27697                                  ;endif
 27698                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022
 27699                                  
 27700                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27701                                  	; 18/12/2022
 27702 00002148 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 27703                                  	;mov	byte [p_buffer_slash_x],0 ; 31/03/2019
 27704 0000214A 880E[591D]              	mov	[p_buffer_slash_x],cl ; 0
 27705

 27707                                  	;xor	cx,cx	; 18/12/2022
 27708                                  	; 03/01/2023
 27709                                  	;mov	dx,cx
 27710                                  do7:

 27712 00002154 7303                    	jnc	short if7		; parse error,
 27713                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  and show messages and end the search loop.
 27714                                  	;;jmp	short sr7

 27720                                  if7:
 27721 00002159 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,_$P_RC_EOL ; 0FFFFh	; end of line?

 27723                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x ; (/X switch)

 27756 0000218A A1[551D]                	mov	ax,[p_buffers]	; we don't have any problem.

 27773                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27774                                  ; break command
 27775                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27776                                  
 27777                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27778                                  ;									    *
 27779                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 27780                                  ;									    *
 27781                                  ; input :								    *
 27782                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 27783                                  ; output:								    *
 27784                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 27785                                  ;									    *
 27786                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 27787                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 27788                                  ; logic:								    *
 27789                                  ; {									    *
 27790                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 27791                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 27792                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 27793                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 27794                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 27795                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 27796                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 27797                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 27798                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 27799                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 27800                                  ;	};								    *
 27801                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 27802                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 27803                                  ; };									    *
 27804                                  ;									    *
 27805                                  ;****************************************************************************
 27806                                  
 27807                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 27808                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)
 27809                                  tryc:
 27810 0000219F 80FC43                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BREAK ; 'C'
 27811 000021A2 7539                    	jne	short trym
 27812                                  
 27813                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 27814                                  ; (SYSINIT:2527h)
 27815                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27816                                  ;%if 0

 27864                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27865                                  ; multitrack command
 27866                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27867                                  
 27868                                  ;******************************************************************************
 27869                                  ;									      *
 27870                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 27871                                  ;									      *
 27872                                  ; input :								      *
 27873                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 27874                                  ; output:								      *
 27875                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 27876                                  ;									      *
 27877                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 27878                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 27879                                  ; logic:								      *
 27880                                  ; {									      *
 27881                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 27882                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 27883                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 27884                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 27885                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 27886                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 27887                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 27888                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 27889                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 27890                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 27891                                  ;	};								      *
 27892                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 27893                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 27894                                  ;									      *
 27895                                  ; };									      *
 27896                                  ;									      *
 27897                                  ;******************************************************************************

 29387                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29388                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 29389                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 29390                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 29391                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 29392                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 29393                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 29394                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 29395                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29396                                  
 29397                                  ;**************************************************************************
 29398                                  ;									  *
 29399                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 29400                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 29401                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 29402                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 29403                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 29404                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 29405                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 29406                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 29407                                  ; input :								  *
 29408                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 29409                                  ; output:								  *
 29410                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 29411                                  ;									  *
 29412                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 29413                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 29414                                  ; logic:								  *
 29415                                  ; {									  *
 29416                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 29417                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 29418                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 29419                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 29420                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 29421                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 29422                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29423                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 29424                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 29425                                  ;	     }								  *
 29426                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 29427                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 29428                                  ;	};								  *
 29429                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 29430                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 29431                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 29432                                  ; };									  *
 29433                                  ;**************************************************************************

 30180                                  sysinit_parse:
 30181                                  
 30182                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30183                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 30184                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 30185                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 30186                                  ;
 30187                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 30188                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 30189                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 30190                                  ;	*** after each call.
 30191                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 30192                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 30193                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 30194                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 30195                                  ;	 procedure.
 30196                                  ;	ax - exit code
 30197                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 30198                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 30199                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 30200                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 30201                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30202                                  
 30203                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30204                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)
 30205

 30548                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 30549                                  ;
 30550                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 30551                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 30552                                  ;
 30553                                  ;	Output : none

 30557                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 30558                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 30559                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 30571                                  	; 13/05/2019
 30572                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 30573                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie

 30589                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30590                                  ;
 30591                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 30592                                  ;
 30593                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 30594                                  ;	Output : none
 30595                                  ;
 30596                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 30597                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 30598                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 30599                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 30600                                  ;
 30601                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30602                                  
 30603                                  	; 01/11/2022
 30604                                  SetInt12Mem:
 30605 00002987 1E                      	push	ds
 30606 00002988 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 30607 0000298B 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 30608 0000298D 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 30609 00002991 2E891E[6B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 30610 00002996 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 30611 00002998 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 30612 0000299A A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 30613 0000299D 2EC606[6A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 30614 000029A3 1F                      	pop	ds
 30615                                  ;limx:
 30616 000029A4 C3                      	retn
 30617                                  
 30618                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30619                                  ;
 30620                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 30621                                  ;
 30622                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 30623                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 30624                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 30625                                  ;
 30626                                  ;	Output : none
 30627                                  ;

 30629                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 30630                                  ;
 30631                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30632

 30638                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 30639                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 30640 000029AA 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 30641                                  	; 18/12/2022
 30642 000029AC B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 30643 000029AF 8826[6A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 30644                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 30645                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0

 30647                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 30648 000029B4 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 30649 000029B6 2EA1[6B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]

 30651 000029BD 1F                      	pop	ds
 30652                                  timx:

 30706                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30707                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 30708                                  
 30709                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 30710                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 30711                                  
 30712                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30713                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 30714                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 30715                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30716                                  
 30717                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30718                                  ;
 30719                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 30720                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 30721                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 30722                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 30723                                  ;
 30724                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 30725                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 30726                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 30727                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 30728                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 30729                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 30730                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 30731                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 30732                                  ; available during the load.
 30733                                  ;
 30734                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 30735                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 30736                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 30737                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 30738                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 30739                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 30740                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 30741                                  ;
 30742                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 30743                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 30744                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 30745                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 30746                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 30747                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 30748                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 30749                                  ;
 30750                                  ;******************************************************************************
 30751                                  
 30752                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 30753                                  
 30754                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 30755                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 30756                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 30757                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 30758                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 30759                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 30760                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 30761                                  
 30762                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 30763                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 30764                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 30765                                  
 30766                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30767                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 30768                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30769                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 30770                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 30771                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 30772                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30773                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30774                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 30775                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 30776                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30777

 30836                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30837                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 30838                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30839                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 30840                                  ; EXIT    : None
 30841                                  ; ERROR   : None
 30842                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 30843                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30844                                  
 30845                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 30846                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 30847                                  FixMem:
 30848                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30849                                  	;push	ax
 30850                                  	;push	bx
 30851                                  	;push	cx
 30852                                  	;push	dx
 30853 00002A11 06                      	push	es
 30854                                  
 30855 00002A12 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 30856                                  
 30857 00002A15 E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 30858 00002A18 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 30859                                  
 30860 00002A1A 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 30861                                  
 30862                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 30863                                  
 30864 00002A1C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 30865 00002A1E 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 30866 00002A20 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 30867                                  
 30868                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30869                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 30870                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 30871                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 30872                                  
 30873 00002A21 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 30874 00002A25 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 30875 00002A2A 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 30876 00002A2C 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 30877                                  
 30878                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 30879                                  
 30880 00002A2E 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 30881 00002A33 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 30882 00002A35 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 30883                                  
 30884 00002A39 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 30885                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 30886                                  	; 11/07/2023
 30887 00002A3E 43                      	inc	bx
 30888 00002A3F 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 30889                                  
 30890                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 30891                                  
 30892 00002A44 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Save MCB address
 30893 00002A46 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 30894                                  
 30895 00002A4B 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 30896                                  	;add	bx,[es:3]
 30897 00002A4D 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 30898 00002A52 43                      	inc	bx
 30899 00002A53 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 30900                                  
 30901                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 30902 00002A55 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 30903 00002A57 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 30904                                  fmX:	
 30905 00002A59 E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 30906                                  
 30907 00002A5C 07                      	pop	es
 30908                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30909                                  	;pop	dx
 30910                                  	;pop	cx
 30911                                  	;pop	bx
 30912                                  	;pop	ax
 30913                                  
 30914 00002A5D C3                      	retn
 30915                                  
 30916                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30917                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 30918                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30919                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 30920                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 30921                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30922                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 30923                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30924                                  
 30925                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30926                                  fm_link:
 30927 00002A5E B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 30928 00002A61 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 30929                                  
 30930                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 30931                                  	;
 30932                                  	;push	es
 30933                                  	;push	cs
 30934                                  	;pop	es
 30935                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 30936                                  	;pop	es
 30937                                  	
 30938                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30939                                  	; ds = cs
 30940                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 30941 00002A63 A2[461F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 30942                                  
 30943 00002A66 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30944 00002A69 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 30945 00002A6C CD21                    	int	21h
 30946 00002A6E C3                      	retn
 30947                                  
 30948                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30949                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 30950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30951                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 30952                                  ; EXIT:     None
 30953                                  ; ERROR:    None
 30954                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 30955                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30956                                  
 30957                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 30958                                  fm_unlink:
 30959 00002A6F 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 30960                                  	
 30961                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 30962                                  	;
 30963                                  	;push	ds
 30964                                  	;push	cs
 30965                                  	;pop	ds
 30966                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 30967                                  	;pop	ds
 30968                                  	
 30969                                  	; 01/01/2023
 30970                                  	; ds = cs
 30971                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 30972 00002A71 8A1E[461F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 30973                                  
 30974 00002A75 B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 30975 00002A78 CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 30976 00002A7A C3                      	retn
 30977                                  
 30978                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 30979                                  
 30980                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30981                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 30982                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 30983                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30984                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 30985                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 30986                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 30987                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 30988                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 30989                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 30990                                  ;
 30991                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 30992                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 30993                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 30994                                  ;
 30995                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 30996                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 30997                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 30998                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 30999                                  ;
 31000                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 31001                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 31002                                  ;
 31003                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31004                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 31005                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 31006                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 31007                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 31008                                  ;     lh
 31009                                  ;     /l
 31010                                  ;     1
 31011                                  ;     1000
 31012                                  ;     2
 31013                                  ;     print
 31014                                  ;     /d
 31015                                  ;     :lpt2
 31016                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 31017                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 31018                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 31019                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 31020                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 31021                                  ; for:
 31022                                  ;    Each /L
 31023                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 31024                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 31025                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 31026                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 31027                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 31028                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31029                                  
 31030                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 31031                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 31032                                  
 31033                                  ParseVar:
 31034                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 31035                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31036                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31037 00002A7B 1E                      	push	ds
 31038 00002A7C 06                      	push	es
 31039                                  
 31040 00002A7D 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 31041 00002A7E 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 31042 00002A7F FC                      	cld
 31043                                  
 31044                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31045                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 31046                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 31047                                  
 31048 00002A80 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 31049 00002A81 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 31050 00002A84 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 31051                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31052 00002A86 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 31053 00002A88 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 31054                                  
 31055 00002A8A 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 31056 00002A8B F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 31057 00002A8C EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 31058                                  pv20:	
 31059 00002A8E AC                      	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 31060                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 31061 00002A8F 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 31062                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 31063 00002A91 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 31064 00002A93 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 31065                                  
 31066                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31067 00002A95 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31068                                  
 31069                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 31070                                  	;
 31071                                  	;push	es
 31072                                  	;push	cs
 31073                                  	;pop	es
 31074                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 31075                                  	;pop	es
 31076                                  
 31077 00002A9A 2EC606[121F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 31078                                  
 31079 00002AA0 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 31080                                  
 31081                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 31082 00002AA2 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then it's a bad
 31083 00002AA4 750D                    	jne	short pvE1	; switch!
 31084                                  
 31085                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 31086 00002AA6 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 31087                                  
 31088 00002AAB E80E00                  	call	parseL
 31089 00002AAE 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 31090                                  
 31091 00002AB0 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 31092 00002AB1 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 31093                                  
 31094                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 31095 00002AB3 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 31096 00002AB6 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 31097 00002AB7 4E                      	dec	si
 31098 00002AB8 F9                      	stc
 31099                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 31100 00002AB9 07                      	pop	es
 31101 00002ABA 1F                      	pop	ds
 31102                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31103                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 31104 00002ABB C3                      	retn
 31105                                  
 31106                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31107                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 31108                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31109                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 31110                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 31111                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 31112                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 31113                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31114                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 31115                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 31116                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax. The 3-character rewind
 31117                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 31118                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31119                                  
 31120                                  parseL:
 31121 00002ABC AC                      	lodsb
 31122 00002ABD 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 31123 00002ABF 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 31124                                  
 31125                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31126                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 31127                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 31128                                  
 31129 00002AC1 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, it's ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 31130 00002AC4 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 31131 00002AC6 E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 31132                                  
 31133 00002AC9 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 31134 00002ACB E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 31135 00002ACE 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 31136                                  
 31137                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 31138 00002AD0 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31139                                  
 31140 00002AD5 AC                      	lodsb
 31141 00002AD6 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 31142 00002AD8 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 31143                                  
 31144 00002ADA E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 31145 00002ADD 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 31146                                  
 31147 00002ADF E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 31148 00002AE2 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31149                                  
 31150                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31151 00002AE4 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 31152 00002AE6 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 31153                                  
 31154 00002AE8 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 31155 00002AEA 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 31156                                  
 31157                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 31158                                  
 31159 00002AEC E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 31160 00002AEF 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 31161                                  
 31162 00002AF1 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 31163                                  
 31164 00002AF4 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 31165                                  
 31166                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 31167 00002AF7 2EFE06[481F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31168                                  
 31169 00002AFC AC                      	lodsb
 31170 00002AFD 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 31171 00002AFF 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 31172                                  
 31173 00002B01 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 31174 00002B04 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 31175                                  
 31176 00002B06 E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 31177 00002B09 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 31178                                  
 31179                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 31180 00002B0B 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 31181 00002B0D 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 31182                                  plE1:	
 31183                                  	;mov	ax,1
 31184 00002B0F B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 31185 00002B12 4E                      	dec	si
 31186 00002B13 F9                      	stc
 31187 00002B14 C3                      	retn
 31188                                  
 31189                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 31190 00002B15 B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 31191                                  	; 12/12/2022
 31192                                  	; cf=1
 31193                                  	;stc
 31194 00002B18 C3                      	retn
 31195                                  plSwX:	
 31196 00002B19 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 31197                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 31198                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 31199                                  	; cf=0
 31200                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 31201 00002B1A C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 31202                                  
 31203                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31204                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 31205                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31206                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 31207                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31208                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31209                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 31210                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31211                                  
 31212                                  ;incArgc:

 31229                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31230                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 31232                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 31233                                  ; ERROR:    None
 31234                                  ; USES:     ZF

 31315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31316                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 31317                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 31318                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 31319                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 31320                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31321                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 31322                                  ; EXIT:     None
 31323                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 31324                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 31325                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31326                                  
 31327                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 31328                                  stowUMB:
 31329 00002B44 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 31330 00002B46 7202                    	jb	short su10
 31331 00002B48 F9                      	stc
 31332 00002B49 C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB # >= MAXUMB
 31333                                  su10:	
 31334                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31335                                  	;push	bx
 31336                                  	;push	di
 31337                                  	;push	si
 31338                                  	;push	ds
 31339                                  	;push	es
 31340                                  	;push	cs
 31341                                  	;pop	es
 31342                                  	;push	cs
 31343                                  	;pop	ds
 31344                                  
 31345                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31346                                  	; ds <> cs
 31347                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 31348 00002B4A 2E803E[151F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 31349                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 31350 00002B50 7504                    	jne	short su20
 31351 00002B52 2EA2[151F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31352                                  
 31353                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 31354                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 31355                                  	;jne	short su20
 31356                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 31357                                  su20:	
 31358 00002B56 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 31359 00002B58 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 31360                                  
 31361                                  	;mov	bl,al
 31362                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 31363                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 31364                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31365 00002B5A 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 31366 00002B5C 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 31367 00002B5E B001                    	mov	al,1
 31368

 31370                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31371 00002B60 2E8687[161F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 31372                                  
 31373                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 31374                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 31375                                  	;
 31376                                  	;stc			; OOOPS! This one's been used before. :(
 31377                                  	
 31378                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31379 00002B65 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 31380 00002B67 F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 31381                                  su30:	
 31382                                  	; 01/01/2023
 31383                                  	;pop	es
 31384                                  	;pop	ds
 31385                                  	;pop	si
 31386                                  	;pop	di
 31387                                  	;pop	bx
 31388 00002B68 C3                      	retn
