 35392                                  ;
 35393                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 35394                                  ;
 35395                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 35396                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 35397                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 35398                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 35399                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 35400                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 35401                                  ;
 35402                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 35403                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 35404                                  ;
 35405                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 35406                                  ;
 35407                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35408                                  
 35409                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35410                                  
 35411                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 35412                                  
 35413                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35414                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)
 35415                                  
 35416                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 35417                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:4236h)
 35418                                  
 35419                                  setdeviceparameters:
 35420                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35421                                  	; ds = cs
 35422

 35424

 35426 000035B2 07                      	pop	es
 35427                                  
 35428 000035B3 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 35429 000035B5 8A1E[2048]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]

 35431 000035BC 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 35432

 35434                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 35435                                  got_80:

 35437 000035C6 8BB7[C849]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb
 35438

 35469 000035EB A3[3548]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax
 35470                                  
 35471                                  heads_not_altered:
 35472                                  
 35473                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 35474                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 35475                                  
 35476                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 35477                                  	; 02/11/2022
 35478                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 35479                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35480 000035EE B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 35481 000035F1 A2[2848]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 35482                                  
 35483 000035F4 B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 35484                                  
 35485                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 35486                                  
 35487                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 35488                                  	; 02/11/2022
 35489 000035F6 8A3E[3048]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 35490                                  	
 35491                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35492                                  	; ax = 2
 35493 000035FA 3906[3548]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 35494                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 35495 000035FE 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediaid ; just use default if heads>2
 35496                                  
 35497 00003600 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 35498                                  
 35499                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 35500                                  
 35501 00003602 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 35502                                  
 35503                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 35504                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 35505                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 35506                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 35507                                  
 35508                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 35509                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 35510                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 35511                                  
 35512 00003604 833E[3348]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 35513 00003609 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 35514 0000360B 833E[2348]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 35515 00003610 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 35516                                  
 35517                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 35518                                  
 35519 00003612 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 35520                                  
 35521                                  ;	check for 320K
 35522                                  
 35523                                  not_144m:
 35524 00003614 833E[2348]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 35525 00003619 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediaid
 35526 0000361B 833E[3348]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 35527 00003620 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediaid
 35528                                  
 35529 00003622 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 35530 00003624 EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediaid
 35531                                  
 35532                                  only_one_head:
 35533                                  
 35534                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 35535                                  
 35536 00003626 803E[2048]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 35537 0000362B 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 35538                                  
 35539                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 35540                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 35541                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 35542                                  
 35543 0000362D B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 35544 0000362F 833E[3348]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 35545                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35546 00003634 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 35547                                  
 35548 00003636 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 35549                                  
 35550                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 35551                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 35552                                  
 35553                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 35554                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35555                                  	; ax = 2
 35556 00003638 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 35557 00003639 A2[2848]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 35558                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 35559                                  
 35560                                  got_correct_mediaid:
 35561 0000363C 881E[3048]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 35562                                  
 35563                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 35564                                  
 35565 00003640 A1[2348]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 35566 00003643 F726[3548]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_HEADS]
 35567 00003647 F726[3348]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK]
 35568 0000364B A3[2E48]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS],ax
 35569 0000364E F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 35570                                  
 35571 0000364F C3                      	retn
 35572                                  
 35573                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 35743                                  ;   If keyword is *immediately* followed by a question mark (?), then
 35744                                  ;   set the high bit of the ASCII command code (CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY) that is
 35745                                  ;   stored in the CONFIG.SYS memory image.

 36117                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36118                                  ;
 36119                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 36120                                  ;
 36121                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 36122                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 36123                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 36124                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 36125                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 36126                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 36127                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 36128                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 36129                                  ;
 36130                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36131                                  
 36132                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36133                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 36134                                  
 36135                                  skip_comment:
 36136 00003858 E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 36137                                  
 36138                                  	; 03/01/2023
 36139                                  	; ds = cs	
 36140                                  
 36141 0000385A 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 36142                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 36143 0000385F 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 36144                                  
 36145 00003861 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 36146                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 36147 00003866 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 36148                                  
 36149 00003868 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 36150                                  	
 36151 0000386B 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 36152                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 36153 0000386F 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 36154                                  
 36155 00003871 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 36156                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 36157 00003876 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 36158                                  
 36159 00003878 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 36160                                  	
 36161 0000387C 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 36162                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 36163 00003880 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 36164                                  skip_cmmt:
 36165 00003882 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 36166 00003884 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 36167 00003887 46                      	inc	si
 36168 00003888 49                      	dec	cx
 36169 00003889 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 36170 0000388B 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 36171                                  no_commt:
 36172 0000388D C3                      	retn

 36182                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36183                                  ;
 36184                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 36185                                  ;
 36186                                  ;   INPUT
 36187                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36188                                  ;
 36189                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36190                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 36191                                  ;
 36192                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36193                                  ;       All
 36194                                  ;
 36195                                  ;   HISTORY
 36196                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36197                                  ;
 36198                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36199                                  
 36200                                  kbd_read:
 36201 0000388E F606[EB46]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 36202 00003893 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 36203                                  
 36204 00003895 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 36205 00003896 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 36206 00003898 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 36207                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 36208                                  kbd_loop:
 36209 0000389A B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 36210 0000389C CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 36211 0000389E 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 36212 000038A0 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36213 000038A2 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36214 000038A4 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36215 000038A6 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 36216 000038A8 A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 36217                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 36218                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36219 000038AB 2E2B06[8603]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 36220                                  
 36221 000038B0 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 36222 000038B2 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 36223                                  kbd_loopdone:
 36224 000038B4 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 36225                                  kbd_nodelay:
 36226 000038B5 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 36227 000038B7 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 36228 000038B9 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36229 000038BB A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 36230 000038BD 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 36231 000038BF 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 36232 000038C0 43                              inc     bx
 36233                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 36234 000038C1 800E[EF46]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 36235                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 36236 000038C6 B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 36237 000038C8 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 36238 000038CA 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 36239 000038CC 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 36240 000038CE 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 36241                                  
 36242                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 36243 000038D0 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 36244 000038D3 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 36245                                  	
 36246 000038D5 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 36247 000038D8 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 36248                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 36249 000038DA BA[834B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 36250 000038DD E8DD0B                          call    print
 36251                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 36252 000038E0 800E[EF46]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 36253 000038E5 EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 36254                                  kbd_notf5:
 36255                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 36256 000038E7 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 36257 000038EA 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 36258                                  
 36259 000038EC 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 36260 000038EF 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 36261                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 36262 000038F1 BA[C14B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 36263 000038F4 E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 36264 000038F7 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 36265 000038F9 881E[EF46]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 36266                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 36267 000038FD B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 36268 000038FF CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 36269 00003901 C606[F546]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 36270 00003906 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 36271 00003908 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 36272                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 36273 0000390A 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 36274 0000390D 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 36275                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 36276 0000390F E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 36277 00003912 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 36278 00003913 C3                              retn			;
 36279                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 36280 00003914 F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 36281 00003915 C3                              retn			;

 36283                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36284                                  ;
 36285                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 36286                                  ;
 36287                                  ;   INPUT
 36288                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 36289                                  ;
 36290                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36291                                  ;       None
 36292                                  ;
 36293                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36294                                  ;       None
 36295                                  ;
 36296                                  ;   HISTORY
 36297                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 36298                                  ;
 36299                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36300                                  
 36301                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36302                                  
 36303                                  set_numlock:
 36304                                          ; 04/01/2023
 36305                                  	;push	ax
 36306 00003916 1E                              push    ds
 36307 00003917 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 36308 00003919 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 36309 0000391B 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 36310 0000391E 2E3B06[5E4B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 36311 00003923 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 36312 00003925 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 36313 0000392A EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 36314                                  not_off:
 36315 0000392C 2E3B06[5C4B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 36316 00003931 F9                              stc
 36317 00003932 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 36318 00003934 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 36319                                  set_done:
 36320 00003939 1F                              pop     ds
 36321                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36322                                  	;pop	ax
 36323 0000393A C3                              retn
 36324                                  
 36325                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36326                                  
 36327                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36328                                  ;
 36329                                  ;   menu_check: check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 36330                                  ;
 36331                                  ;   INPUT
 36332                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 36333                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 36334                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 36335                                  ;
 36336                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36337                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 36338                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 36339                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 36340                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 36341                                  ;
 36342                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36343                                  ;       All
 36344                                  ;
 36345                                  ;   NOTES
 36346                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 36347                                  ;
 36348                                  ;   HISTORY
 36349                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36350                                  ;
 36351                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36352                                  
 36353                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36354                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 36355                                  
 36356                                  menu_check:
 36357                                  
 36358                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 36359                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 36360                                  
 36361 0000393B 51                              push    cx              ;
 36362 0000393C 56                              push    si              ;
 36363 0000393D 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 36364                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 36365 0000393F E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 36366 00003942 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 36367 00003944 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 36368 00003946 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 36369 00003948 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 36370 00003949 EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36371                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 36372 0000394B 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 36373 0000394D 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 36374 0000394F 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 36375 00003951 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 36376 00003953 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 36377 00003956 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 36378 0000395B EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 36379                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 36380 0000395D 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 36381 0000395F 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 36382                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 36383 00003961 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 36384                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 36385 00003964 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 36386 00003966 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 36387 00003968 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 36388 0000396A 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 36389 0000396C E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 36390 0000396F 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 36391 00003971 3A06[A51E]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]
 36392 00003975 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 36393 00003977 800E[EB46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 36394 0000397C EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 36395                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 36396 0000397E 3A06[B11E]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]
 36397 00003982 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 36398 00003984 800E[EB46]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 36399 00003989 EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 36400                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 36401 0000398B E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36402 0000398E EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 36403                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 36404 00003990 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36405 00003991 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36406                                  
 36407                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 36408                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 36409                                  
 36410 00003992 F606[EB46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36411 00003997 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 36412                                  ;
 36413                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 36414                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 36415                                  ;
 36416 00003999 E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 36417 0000399C 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 36418 0000399E E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 36419                                  
 36420                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 36421                                  
 36422                                  menu_search:
 36423 000039A1 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 36424 000039A3 BF[3047]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 36425 000039A6 E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 36426 000039A9 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 36427 000039AB C606[2847]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 36428 000039B0 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 36429                                  
 36430                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 36431                                  
 36432                                  menu_color:
 36433 000039B3 51                      	push	cx              ;
 36434 000039B4 52                      	push	dx              ;
 36435                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 36436                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36437                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 36438 000039B5 E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 36439 000039B8 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 36440 000039BB 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 36441                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 36442                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 36443                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 36444                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 36445 000039BD 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 36446 000039BF E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 36447 000039C2 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 36448 000039C4 E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 36449 000039C7 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 36450 000039CA 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 36451                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36452                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 36453 000039CC B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 36454 000039CE D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 36455 000039D0 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 36456                                  check_color:
 36457 000039D2 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 36458 000039D4 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 36459 000039D6 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 36460                                  set_color:
 36461 000039D9 8816[E646]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 36462 000039DD 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 36463 000039DE 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 36464 000039DF E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 36465                                  
 36466                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 36467                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 36468                                  
 36469                                  menu_found:
 36470 000039E2 C606[F046]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 36471                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 36472 000039E7 C606[F446]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 36473 000039EC 8026[EF46]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 36474                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36475 000039F1 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 36476 000039F3 8916[F246]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 36477                                  
 36478 000039F7 E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 36479                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36480                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 36481                                  
 36482                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 36483                                  
 36484                                  menu_process:
 36485 000039FA E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 36486 000039FD 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 36487 000039FF 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36488 00003A01 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 36489 00003A03 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 36490 00003A05 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 36491 00003A07 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 36492 00003A09 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 36493 00003A0B 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 36494 00003A0D 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 36495 00003A0F 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 36496 00003A11 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 36497 00003A13 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 36498 00003A15 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 36499 00003A17 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 36500 00003A19 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 36501 00003A1B 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 36502 00003A1D E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 36503 00003A20 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 36504 00003A22 F9                              stc                     ;
 36505 00003A23 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 36506 00003A26 EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36507                                  menu_numlock:
 36508 00003A28 E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 36509 00003A2B EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36510                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 36511 00003A2D EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 36512                                  
 36513                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 36514                                  
 36515                                  menu_default:
 36516 00003A2F 8936[F246]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 36517 00003A33 803E[F546]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 36518 00003A38 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 36519 00003A3A E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 36520 00003A3D 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 36521 00003A3F E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 36522 00003A42 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 36523 00003A44 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 36524 00003A46 E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 36525 00003A49 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 36526                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 36527 00003A4C 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 36528 00003A4E B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 36529                                  timeout_ok:                     ;
 36530 00003A50 881E[F446]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 36531                                  timeout_skip:
 36532 00003A54 EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 36533                                  
 36534                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 36535                                  
 36536                                  menu_item:
 36537                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 36538 00003A56 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 36539 00003A59 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 36540 00003A5B 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 36541 00003A5D E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 36542 00003A60 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 36543 00003A62 F9                              stc                     ;
 36544 00003A63 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 36545 00003A66 EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 36546                                  
 36547                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 36548                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 36549                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 36550                                  
 36551                                  menu_itemfound:
 36552 00003A68 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 36553 00003A69 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 36554 00003A6B 8887[F646]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 36555 00003A6F 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 36556                                  
 36557                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 36558                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 36559                                  ;   description...
 36560                                  
 36561 00003A71 89B7[0047]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 36562 00003A75 89B7[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 36563 00003A79 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 36564 00003A7B E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 36565 00003A7E 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 36566 00003A80 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 36567 00003A83 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 36568 00003A85 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 36569 00003A87 89BF[1447]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 36570                                  
 36571                                  menu_nextitem:
 36572 00003A8B E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36573 00003A8E E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 36574                                  
 36575                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 36576                                  
 36577                                  menu_getdefault:
 36578 00003A91 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 36579 00003A93 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 36580 00003A95 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 36581 00003A97 E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 36582                                  menu_valid:
 36583 00003A9A 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 36584 00003A9C 8816[F146]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 36585 00003AA0 8B3E[F246]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 36586 00003AA4 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 36587 00003AA6 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 36588 00003AA8 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 36589                                  menu_chkdefault:
 36590 00003AA9 53                              push    bx              ;
 36591 00003AAA 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36592 00003AAC 8BB7[0047]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36593 00003AB0 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 36594 00003AB3 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36595 00003AB4 06                              push    es              ;
 36596 00003AB5 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36597 00003AB6 E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 36598 00003AB9 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36599 00003ABA 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 36600 00003ABB 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 36601 00003ABD 43                              inc     bx              ;
 36602 00003ABE 3A1E[F146]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 36603 00003AC2 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 36604                                  menu_nodefault:
 36605 00003AC4 B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 36606                                  menu_setdefault:
 36607 00003AC6 881E[F046]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 36608                                  
 36609                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 36610                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 36611                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 36612                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 36613                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 36614                                  ;   with no timeout)
 36615                                  
 36616 00003ACA 803E[F446]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 36617 00003ACF 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 36618 00003AD1 F606[EF46]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 36619 00003AD6 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 36620 00003AD8 E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 36621                                  
 36622                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 36623                                  
 36624                                  menu_display:
 36625 00003ADB B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 36626 00003ADD CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36627 00003ADF B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 36628 00003AE1 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36629 00003AE3 06                              push    es              ;
 36630 00003AE4 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 36631 00003AE7 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 36632 00003AE9 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 36633 00003AED A3[ED46]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 36634 00003AF0 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 36635 00003AF4 A2[EC46]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 36636 00003AF7 A1[E746]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 36637 00003AFA CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36638 00003AFC B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 36639 00003AFF 8A3E[E646]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 36640 00003B03 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 36641                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 36642 00003B05 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 36643 00003B0A FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 36644                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 36645 00003B0C 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 36646 00003B11 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 36647 00003B13 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 36648 00003B15 8A36[EA46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 36649                                  menu_clear:
 36650 00003B19 CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 36651 00003B1B 07                              pop     es              ;
 36652 00003B1C 8836[EA46]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 36653 00003B20 BA[FE4B]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 36654 00003B23 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 36655                                  
 36656 00003B26 F606[EB46]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 36657 00003B2B 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 36658 00003B2D 8A3E[E746]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 36659 00003B31 8A36[EA46]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 36660 00003B35 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 36661 00003B37 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 36662 00003B39 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36663 00003B3B BA[4C4C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 36664 00003B3E E87C09                          call    print           ;
 36665 00003B41 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 36666 00003B43 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36667 00003B45 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 36668 00003B48 8816[E946]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 36669                                  
 36670                                  menu_nostatus:
 36671 00003B4C BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 36672                                  menu_disploop:
 36673 00003B4F E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 36674 00003B52 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 36675 00003B53 3A1E[F146]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 36676 00003B57 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 36677                                  
 36678                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 36679                                  
 36680 00003B59 B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 36681 00003B5B 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;
 36682 00003B5D 80C604                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 36683 00003B60 8A3E[E746]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 36684 00003B64 B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 36685 00003B66 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 36686                                  
 36687 00003B68 BA[394C]                        mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 36688 00003B6B E84F09                          call    print           ;
 36689 00003B6E E82903                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 36690 00003B71 BA[0A4A]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 36691 00003B74 E84609                          call    print           ;
 36692 00003B77 FF36[EB46]                      push    word [bDisableUI]
 36693 00003B7B 800E[EB46]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 36694 00003B80 E86704                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 36695 00003B83 8F06[EB46]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 36696                                  
 36697                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 36698                                  
 36699                                  menu_autoselect:
 36700 00003B87 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 36701 00003B8A 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no
 36702 00003B8C E8F105                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 36703                                  menu_abort:
 36704 00003B8F 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 36705 00003B91 E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 36706                                  
 36707                                  normal_boot:
 36708 00003B94 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 36709 00003B97 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 36710 00003B99 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 36711 00003B9D 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36712 00003B9F E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 36713                                  
 36714                                  not_topmenu:
 36715 00003BA2 80BF[F646]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 36716 00003BA7 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 36717 00003BA9 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 36718 00003BAB 8BBF[0047]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36719 00003BAF E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 36720 00003BB2 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 36721 00003BB4 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 36722 00003BB6 E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 36723                                  
 36724                                  not_submenu:
 36725 00003BB9 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 36726 00003BBB 8B9F[0047]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 36727                                  
 36728                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 36729                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 36730                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 36731                                  
 36732                                  no_selection:
 36733 00003BBF 891E[F246]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 36734 00003BC3 8B0E[5603]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 36735 00003BC7 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36736 00003BC9 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36737 00003BCA 8E1E[A214]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 36738 00003BCE 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 36739                                  
 36740                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 36741                                  ;
 36742                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 36743                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 36744                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
 36745                                  ;   copied by copy_block in a recursive fashion; the amount of recursion is
 36746                                  ;   limited by the fact INCLUDE statements are REMed by copy_block as they are
 36747                                  ;   processed and by the number of unique INCLUDE stmts in config.sys...
 36748                                  ;
 36749                                  ;   BUGBUG 20-Mar-1992 JeffPar: If we can figure out the lower bound of the
 36750                                  ;   stack we're running on, then we should check it inside copy_block
 36751                                  
 36752                                  copyblock_loop:
 36753 00003BD0 53                              push    bx              ; save selected block name
 36754 00003BD1 E82F01                          call    copy_block      ; process (named or common) block
 36755 00003BD4 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 36756 00003BD5 7232                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36757                                  
 36758                                  ;   copy_block can only return for two reasons: it hit eof or a new block
 36759                                  
 36760                                  copyblock_begin:
 36761                                  
 36762                                  ; 10/09/2023
 36763                                  %if 0
 36764                                          push    ax              ;
 36765                                          push    cx              ;
 36766                                          push    si              ;
 36767                                          push    di              ; always do "common" blocks
 36768                                          mov     di,szCommon
 36769                                          push    ds              ;
 36770                                          push    cs              ;
 36771                                          pop     ds              ;
 36772                                          call    comp_names      ;
 36773                                          pop     ds              ;
 36774                                          pop     di              ;
 36775                                          pop     si              ;
 36776                                          pop     cx              ;
 36777                                          pop     ax              ;
 36778                                          je	short copyblock_check
 36779                                  %endif
 36780                                  	; 10/09/2023
 36781 00003BD7 57                      	push	di
 36782 00003BD8 BF[3547]                	mov	di,szCommon	; always do "common" blocks
 36783 00003BDB E81602                  	call	comp_names_x	; (comp_names_safe)
 36784 00003BDE 5F                      	pop	di
 36785 00003BDF 740F                    	je	short copyblock_check
 36786                                  
 36787 00003BE1 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; is there a block name to check?
 36788 00003BE3 7414                            jz	short copyblock_skip ; no
 36789 00003BE5 57                              push    di              ;
 36790 00003BE6 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; check block against given block name
 36791 00003BE8 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36792 00003BE9 06                              push    es              ;
 36793 00003BEA 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36794 00003BEB E8E501                          call    comp_names      ; is this the block we really want to do?
 36795 00003BEE 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36796 00003BEF 5F                              pop     di              ;
 36797                                  copyblock_check:
 36798 00003BF0 7217                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36799 00003BF2 7505                            jne	short copyblock_skip ;
 36800 00003BF4 E85A04                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 36801 00003BF7 EBD7                            jmp	short copyblock_loop
 36802                                  
 36803                                  copyblock_skip:                 ;
 36804 00003BF9 E85504                          call    skip_opt_line   ; this ain't the block we wanted, so skip it
 36805 00003BFC E87804                          call    get_char        ;
 36806 00003BFF 7208                            jc	short move_config ; hit eof
 36807 00003C01 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 36808 00003C03 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ;
 36809 00003C05 74D0                            je	short copyblock_begin
 36810 00003C07 EBF0                            jmp     short copyblock_skip ; anything else is just skipped
 36811                                  ;
 36812                                  ;   To create as little risk to the rest of SysInit as little as possible,
 36813                                  ;   and to free the workspace at "config_wrkseg" for creating an environment,
 36814                                  ;   copy the new config.sys image to "confbot"
 36815                                  ;
 36816                                  move_config:
 36817 00003C09 89F9                            mov     cx,di           ; now copy workspace at DS:DI to "confbot"
 36818 00003C0B 51                              push    cx              ;
 36819                                  ;
 36820                                  ;   But first, copy the CONFIG=<configuration><0> string to the workspace,
 36821                                  ;   since the configuration name only currently exists in the "confbot" area
 36822                                  ;
 36823                                   	;mov	cx,7
 36824 00003C0C B90700                  	mov     cx,szMenu-szBoot-1
 36825 00003C0F BE[2847]                        mov     si,szBoot	; first copy the CONFIG= part
 36826 00003C12 47                              inc     di              ; skip a byte, in case absolutely nothing
 36827                                                                  ; was copied to the workspace, because we always
 36828                                                                  ; zero the first byte of the workspace (below)
 36829                                  copy_boot: 
 36830                                  	;lods    byte ptr cs:[si];
 36831 00003C13 2E                              cs
 36832 00003C14 AC                      	lodsb
 36833 00003C15 8805                    	mov     [di],al         ;
 36834 00003C17 47                              inc     di              ;
 36835 00003C18 E2F9                            loop    copy_boot       ;
 36836                                  
 36837 00003C1A 06                              push    es              ; then copy the configuration name
 36838                                          ;mov	cx,128-7	; put an upper limit on the name, to be safe
 36839                                  	; 04/01/2023
 36840 00003C1B B179                    	mov	cl,128-7
 36841 00003C1D 2E8B36[F246]            	mov     si,[cs:offDefBlock]; ES:SI -> default block name
 36842 00003C22 09F6                            or      si,si           ; valid?
 36843 00003C24 7505                            jnz	short l1	; yes
 36844 00003C26 0E                              push    cs              ;
 36845 00003C27 07                              pop     es              ;
 36846 00003C28 BE[3547]                        mov     si,szCommon
 36847 00003C2B 268A04                  l1:     mov     al,[es:si]      ;
 36848 00003C2E E8B205                          call    any_delim       ;
 36849 00003C31 7406                            je	short l2	;
 36850 00003C33 8805                            mov     [di],al         ;
 36851 00003C35 46                              inc     si              ;
 36852 00003C36 47                              inc     di              ;
 36853 00003C37 E2F2                            loop    l1              ;
 36854 00003C39 C6050A                  l2:     mov     byte [di],lf	; terminate the configuration string
 36855 00003C3C 07                              pop     es              ;
 36856                                  
 36857                                  ;   Now we can copy "config_wrkseg" (DS) to "confbot" (ES)
 36858                                  
 36859 00003C3D 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 36860 00003C3F 2E893E[A014]                    mov     [cs:config_envlen],di
 36861 00003C44 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 36862 00003C46 59                              pop     cx              ; recover the size of "config_wrkseg"
 36863                                  
 36864 00003C47 51                              push    cx              ;
 36865 00003C48 F3A4                            rep     movsb           ; moved!
 36866 00003C4A 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36867 00003C4B 8CD8                            mov     ax,ds           ;
 36868 00003C4D 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 36869                                  
 36870                                  ;   Now that the config_wrkseg is available once again, we shall
 36871                                  ;   use it to create an environment. The first thing to go in will be
 36872                                  ;   the "CONFIG=configuration" thing. It is also important to zero
 36873                                  ;   the first byte of the workspace, so that copy_envvar knows the buffer
 36874                                  ;   is empty.
 36875                                  
 36876 00003C4E 06                              push    es              ;
 36877 00003C4F 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 36878 00003C51 46                              inc     si              ; ES:SI -> "CONFIG=configuration"
 36879 00003C52 26C606000000                    mov     byte [es:0],0	; empty the environment block
 36880 00003C58 E82600                          call    copy_envvar     ; copy envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 36881 00003C5B 07                              pop     es
 36882                                  
 36883                                  ;   Before returning, restore the default video page setting but do NOT
 36884                                  ;   do it using INT 10h's Set Active Page function, because if the menu was
 36885                                  ;   displayed on a different page, then it's because we don't want to see
 36886                                  ;   all the device driver/TSR goop (which goes to the default page)
 36887                                  
 36888                                  menu_done:
 36889 00003C5C 803E[E746]00                    cmp     byte [bMenuPage],0
 36890 00003C61 7415                            je	short menu_exit	;
 36891 00003C63 06                              push    es              ;
 36892 00003C64 B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ;
 36893 00003C67 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ;
 36894 00003C69 A1[ED46]                        mov     ax,[wCRTStart]  ;
 36895 00003C6C 26A34E00                        mov     [es:004Eh],ax   ;
 36896 00003C70 A0[EC46]                        mov     al,[bCRTPage]   ;
 36897 00003C73 26A26200                        mov     [es:0062h],al   ;
 36898 00003C77 07                              pop     es              ;
 36899                                  menu_exit:
 36900 00003C78 890E[5603]                      mov     [count],cx      ; set new counts
 36901 00003C7C 890E[5803]                      mov     [org_count],cx  ;
 36902                                          ; 10/09/2023 (*)
 36903                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:46D3h
 36904                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:491Ah
 36905                                  	;sub	si,si           ; always return ES:SI pointing to config.sys
 36906 00003C80 C3                      	retn
 36907                                  
 36908                                  ; (*) NOTE: MSDOS 6.0 source code (SYSINIT2.ASM) contains 'sub si,si' at this
 36909                                  ;	position (then 'retn' just after it)
 36910                                  ;	but MSDOS 6.21 and PCDOS 7.1 SYSINITs contain only 'retn' here.
 36911                                  
 36912                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36913                                  ;
 36914                                  ;   copy_envvar: copy the envvar at ES:SI to "config_wrkseg"
 36915                                  ;
 36916                                  ;   INPUT
 36917                                  ;    ES:SI -> environment variable (in the form "var=string<cr/lf>")
 36918                                  ;
 36919                                  ;   OUTPUT
 36920                                  ;       config_envlen (ie, where to put next envvar) updated appropriately
 36921                                  ;       carry set if error (eg, missing =); clear otherwise
 36922                                  ;
 36923                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 36924                                  ;       None
 36925                                  ;
 36926                                  ;   NOTES
 36927                                  ;       None
 36928                                  ;
 36929                                  ;   HISTORY
 36930                                  ;       Created 29-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 36931                                  ;
 36932                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36933                                  
 36934                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36935                                  	; (SYSINIT:46D4h)
 36936                                  
 36937                                  copy_envvar:
 36938 00003C81 51                              push    cx              ;
 36939 00003C82 56                              push    si              ;
 36940 00003C83 1E                              push    ds              ;
 36941 00003C84 06                              push    es              ;
 36942 00003C85 06                              push    es              ;
 36943 00003C86 8E06[A214]                      mov     es,[config_wrkseg] ; ES:DI to point to next available byte
 36944 00003C8A 1F                              pop     ds                 ; DS:SI to point to envvar
 36945                                  
 36946                                  ;   Have to calculate the length of the variable name (and if we hit
 36947                                  ;   the end of the line before we hit '=', then it's curtains for this
 36948                                  ;   config.sys line)
 36949                                  ;
 36950                                  ;   The check for NULL is important because copy_envvar is also used to copy
 36951                                  ;   the initial CONFIG= setting, which will have been zapped by a NULL if no
 36952                                  ;   menu block existed (in order to prevent the creation of an environment)
 36953                                  
 36954 00003C8B 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ;
 36955                                  copy_varlen:                    ;
 36956 00003C8D AC                              lodsb                   ;
 36957 00003C8E 08C0                            or      al,al           ; NULL?
 36958                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36959 00003C90 746B                            jz	short copy_envexit ; yes, abort
 36960 00003C92 3C0D                            cmp     al,cr           ;
 36961                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36962 00003C94 7467                            je	short copy_envexit
 36963 00003C96 3C0A                            cmp     al,lf           ;
 36964                                          ;stc	; 10/09/2023 (x)
 36965 00003C98 7463                            je	short copy_envexit
 36966 00003C9A 41                              inc     cx              ;
 36967 00003C9B 3C3D                            cmp     al,'='          ;
 36968 00003C9D 75EE                            jne	short copy_varlen
 36969 00003C9F B000                            mov     al,0            ;
 36970 00003CA1 8A24                            mov     ah,[si]         ; save char after '='
 36971 00003CA3 29CE                            sub     si,cx           ; back up to given varname
 36972 00003CA5 49                              dec     cx              ; CX == # of bytes in varname
 36973 00003CA6 29FF                            sub     di,di           ; start looking for DS:SI at ES:0
 36974                                  copy_varsrch:
 36975 00003CA8 263805                          cmp     byte [es:di],al
 36976 00003CAB 7425                            je	short copy_envprep ; search failed, just copy var
 36977 00003CAD 89FB                            mov     bx,di           ; ES:BX -> start of this varname
 36978 00003CAF 51                              push    cx              ;
 36979 00003CB0 56                              push    si              ;
 36980 00003CB1 F3A6                            repe    cmpsb           ;
 36981 00003CB3 5E                              pop     si              ;
 36982 00003CB4 59                              pop     cx              ;
 36983 00003CB5 7531                            jne	short copy_varnext ; no match, skip to next varname
 36984 00003CB7 26803D3D                        cmp     byte [es:di],'='
 36985 00003CBB 752B                            jne     short copy_varnext ; no match, there's more characters
 36986                                  
 36987                                  ;   Previous occurrence of variable has been found; determine the
 36988                                  ;   entire length and then destroy it
 36989                                  
 36990 00003CBD B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 36991 00003CC0 F2AE                            repne   scasb           ; guaranteed to get null (since we put it there)
 36992 00003CC2 56                              push    si              ;
 36993 00003CC3 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 36994 00003CC5 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ;
 36995 00003CC7 2E8B0E[A014]                    mov     cx,[cs:config_envlen]
 36996 00003CCC 29F1                            sub     cx,si           ; destroy variable now
 36997                                  	;rep movs byte ptr es:[di],byte ptr es:[si]
 36998                                  	;;db 0F3h,26h,0A4h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4724h
 36999                                  
 37000 00003CCE F3                      	rep	; 0F3h
 37001 00003CCF 26                      	es	; 26h
 37002 00003CD0 A4                      	movsb	; 0A4h
 37003                                  
 37004 00003CD1 5E                      	pop     si
 37005                                  copy_envprep:
 37006 00003CD2 80FC0D                          cmp     ah,cr          ; if there is nothing after the '='
 37007 00003CD5 741D                            je	short copy_envdel ; then just exit with variable deleted
 37008 00003CD7 80FC0A                          cmp     ah,lf           ;
 37009 00003CDA 7418                            je	short copy_envdel
 37010                                          ;jmp	short copy_envloop
 37011                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37012                                  copy_envloop:                  ;
 37013 00003CDC AC                      	lodsb                   ;
 37014 00003CDD 3C0D                    	cmp	al,cr           ;
 37015 00003CDF 7410                    	je	short copy_envdone
 37016 00003CE1 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf           ;
 37017 00003CE3 740C                    	je	short copy_envdone
 37018 00003CE5 AA                      	stosb                   ;
 37019 00003CE6 EBF4                    	jmp	short copy_envloop
 37020                                  
 37021                                  copy_varnext:                   ;
 37022 00003CE8 51                              push    cx              ;
 37023 00003CE9 B9FFFF                          mov     cx,-1           ;
 37024 00003CEC F2AE                            repne   scasb           ;
 37025 00003CEE 59                              pop     cx              ;
 37026 00003CEF EBB7                            jmp	short copy_varsrch
 37027                                  
 37028                                  	; 04/01/2023
 37029                                  ;copy_envloop:                  ;
